About the job
À propos de Dialogue
Dialogue est le principal fournisseur de soins virtuels au Canada. En perfectionnant notre Plateforme de santé intégrée, nous offrons des programmes exceptionnels de santé et de bien-être en ligne (soins primaires, santé mentale, TCCi, PAE et bien-être) aux organisations qui souhaitent améliorer le bien-être de leurs employé(e)s et de leurs familles.
Lorsqu'il S'agit De Notre Travail, Nous Plaçons La Barre Très Haut. Ensemble, Nous Transformons La Santé Et Aidons Des Millions De Personnes à Améliorer Leur Bien-être. Nous Croyons Fermement Qu’une Équipe Exceptionnelle Exige Plus Pour Sa
Réussite
Communauté
Croissance
Performance
Vous avez l’impression de pouvoir changer les choses? Bonne nouvelle, nous avons une place pour vous!
Nous vous acceptons comme vous êtes. En tant qu’employeur soucieux de l’égalité des chances, Dialogue s’engage à créer un lieu de travail diversifié et inclusif pour tout le monde. Les personnes qualifiées qui poseront leur candidature seront considérées sans égard à la citoyenneté, l’origine ethnique, la race, la couleur, la religion, le sexe, l’identité ou l’expression sexuelle, l’orientation sexuelle, le handicap, l’âge ou le statut de vétéran. Les personnes qui ont besoin d’accommodations spéciaux sont invitées à nous écrire à l’adresse accessibilite@dialogue.co 
Déclaration sur l'utilisation de l'IA 
Afin d'assurer un processus d'examen efficace et équitable, nous utilisons des outils d'intelligence artificielle pour aider au tri et à l'évaluation initiale des candidatures pour ce poste.
Votre rôle à titre de Développeur(se) en intégration de l’IA
En tant que Développeur(se) en intégration de l’IA au sein du groupe Provider Stream, vous ferez partie de l’équipe responsable de relier des technologies d’automatisation avancées à nos opérations cliniques. La mission consiste à bâtir l’infrastructure de « Prestataire intelligent » — en développant des systèmes qui éliminent la charge administrative et améliorent la prise de décision clinique.
Ce rôle est un hybride à fort impact entre l’IA et le génie logiciel backend. Les responsabilités associées à ce poste incluent la conception de pipelines sécurisés et évolutifs qui nous permettent de tirer parti des meilleures solutions existantes dans un environnement médical à forts enjeux. Vous veillerez à ce que chaque automatisation soit fondée, validée et prête pour la mise en production.
Vos responsabilités
Architecture backend évolutive : Concevoir et maintenir des microservices et des API à forte concurrence qui constituent l’épine dorsale des outils d’automatisation destinés aux prestataires.
Intégration de systèmes : Architecturer des flux de travail « agentiques » robustes et des couches d’intégration afin de connecter les données cliniques internes à des moteurs de raisonnement externes et à des services d’automatisation.
Infrastructure et DevOps : Gérer le déploiement, la mise à l’échelle et la fiabilité des services d’intégration à l’aide de la conteneurisation, du CI/CD et de l’infrastructure en tant que code.
Cadres de validation : Concevoir des pipelines automatisés de tests et d’évaluation afin de mesurer l’exactitude, la sécurité et la fiabilité des résultats des systèmes avant qu’ils ne soient transmis aux clinicien(ne)s.
Sécurité et confidentialité : Mettre en œuvre des protocoles rigoureux de masquage des données et de transmission sécurisée afin d’assurer que toutes les intégrations respectent les normes relatives aux renseignements médicaux personnels (PHI).
Observabilité : Développer des mécanismes avancés de surveillance et de traçage des systèmes intégrés afin de suivre la performance, la latence et l’efficacité des coûts.
Nous aimerions beaucoup vous rencontrer si vous possédez 
Une solide expertise backend : Plus de 5 ans d’expérience en Python (FastAPI/Django) ou dans des langages similaires, avec une excellente maîtrise des systèmes distribués et de l’architecture événementielle.
Une expertise DevOps : Une expérience démontrée avec AWS (Bedrock, Lambda, ECS), Terraform et Kubernetes afin d’assurer l’évolution et la haute disponibilité des systèmes.
Une expérience en intégration : Une connaissance pratique de la connexion de systèmes hétérogènes via REST/gRPC, de la gestion des limites de taux et du traitement de files de tâches asynchrones (p. ex. Celery, Redis).
Une approche axée sur la validation et la qualité : Une expérience dans la conception de systèmes d’« évaluation » — vous privilégiez une validation fondée sur les données plutôt que des tests manuels basés sur l’intuition.
Une approche axée sur la sécurité : Une compréhension approfondie de la sécurisation des environnements cloud et de la gestion de données sensibles dans un secteur réglementé (SOC2, HIPAA ou LPRPDE/PIPEDA).
Le bilinguisme : Essentiel pour valider et dépanner les résultats des systèmes destinés à notre personnel clinique francophone et anglophone.
Veuillez noter qu’étant donné que nous servons des client(e)s situé(e)s dans tout le Canada, il est essentiel d’être bilingue pour ce poste. Vous pourriez être amené(e) à communiquer en français et en anglais.
Chez Dialogue, votre bien-être est notre priorité.
Prendre Soin Des Autres, C’est Aussi Prendre Soin De Notre Équipe! Selon Votre Rôle Et Votre Statut D’emploi, Vous Pourriez Avoir Accès Aux Avantages Suivants

Job Title: Data and AI Customer Solutions Architect
Salary: The typical pay range for this role is $106,000 - $160,000.
Job Description:
About the job
Why You’ll Love Softchoice
We are a software-focused IT solutions and services provider that equips organizations to be agile and innovative, and for their people to be engaged, connected, and creative at work. That means moving them to the cloud, helping them build the workplace of tomorrow, and enabling them to make smarter decisions about their technology. By doing these things we help them create success for their customers and their people.
We stand proudly for our people and support their success through career development and advancement. We are recognized and respected for our culture of inclusion and belonging, continuously striving to do what’s good for our people and communities.
The Impact You Will Have
Are you ready to be at the forefront of the AI revolution, shaping the future of how organizations harness cutting-edge technology to drive real, measurable results? As a pivotal member of our team, you won’t just be selling solutions—you’ll be empowering our customers to unlock the full potential of workplace AI, intelligent agents, and robust data platforms, regardless of the cloud ecosystem they prefer.
At Softchoice, your influence will reach far beyond pilots and proofs of concept. You’ll have the unique opportunity to architect and deliver AI strategies that become the backbone of our customers’ success, transforming how they work, innovate, and compete. Through our integrated consulting and engineering approach—leveraging deep alliances with Microsoft, AWS, and Google Cloud—you’ll help organizations move from vision to execution, making AI practical, durable, and truly impactful.
Imagine being the trusted advisor who brings clarity to complex challenges, guiding senior executives to align on a transformative AI roadmap. You’ll be instrumental in shaping business cases that deliver productivity gains, reduce operational costs, and strengthen compliance—while mapping out the tangible ROI that drives executive buy-in and long-term adoption.
In this role, you’ll quarterback a high-performing team of account executives, solution architects, and technical experts, orchestrating seamless collaboration to deliver AI solutions tailored precisely to each customer’s unique needs. You’ll facilitate boardroom-level discussions, influence strategic decision-making, and see your recommendations come to life in ways that redefine what’s possible for your clients.
If you’re passionate about making a lasting impact, eager to champion responsible AI adoption, and thrive on building relationships that fuel innovation—this is your chance to be the catalyst for real change, helping organizations across industries shape their futures with confidence and clarity..
Who You Will Be Working With
This role will report to the regional leader of technical sales and be part of a “technical sales” organization. 
You will work with our most strategic customers looking to guide their AI journey leading to a transformation of their business. 
You and your team will be directly supported by technical solution architects and engineers, bringing technical acumen early in the sales cycle to ensure our customers find fast value in their discussions with you. 
You will collaborate with account executives, sales leadership and GTM team members, in partnership to ensure we grow our AI business together. 
What You Will Do
Own the executive sales cycle from discovery to close: map business problems to offers, orchestrate virtual teams (pre‑sales architects, delivery, partners), shape proposals/SOWs, and negotiate to signature. 
Lead with value/ROI: build business cases (productivity, cost to serve, compliance/risk), success metrics, and adoption plans for measurable impact. 
Facilitate C-level conversations to enhance understanding of AI and bring alignment at customers to specific AI initiatives 
Partner co‑sell & funding: align with Microsoft (and other hyperscalers) to unlock workshops, AMMP/MDF, and POC funding motions that accelerate deals. 
Pipeline discipline: maintain accurate Salesforce hygiene and weekly cadence on funnel adds and sufficiency; leverage Sales Ops dashboards. 
Evangelize responsibly: position governance, identity, Purview, DLP, and COE patterns to reduce risk while scaling value. 
Professional Experience
What you bring to the table:
The ideal candidate will bring 5 to 10 or more years of demonstrated success in solutions sales, specifically focused on data platforms, analytics, or artificial intelligence. This experience should include a proven track record in selling multi-workload programs and professional services. 
Cloud and Platform Expertise 
Microsoft: Proficiency with Microsoft Fabric, Azure AI, M365 Copilot, and Copilot Studio/Agents. 
AWS: Familiarity with Bedrock, SageMaker, and a range of data analytics services, including an understanding of patterns for Amazon Q and related guardrails. 
Google Cloud: Experience with Vertex AI, Dialogflow/CCAI, and BigQuery analytics patterns. 
Ecosystem: Awareness of Databricks and Snowflake lakehouse patterns, as well as business intelligence platforms such as Power BI, Looker, or QuickSight, as applicable. 
Business Acumen 
The candidate should possess the ability to translate executive-level objectives—such as growth, margin, risk, and customer/employee experience—into a well-structured AI roadmap and adoption plan. They must be able to present a clear narrative connecting agents, data, and governance to desired business outcomes. 
Team Leadership and Orchestration 
Proven capability in leading virtual pursuit teams and coordinating partner co-selling and funding efforts is essential. 
Technical Familiarity 
The candidate should be familiar with agentic patterns, including Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), tool use, and orchestration, and understand how these patterns intersect with line-of-business applications and data estates. 
Willingness and ability to travel frequently within a designated Sales District, up to 25% of the time. 
Pay Range
The typical pay range for this role is $106,000 - $160,000.
Note: the pay range represents the full pay range for this position. Each individual offer will take into consideration a range of factors, including prior experience and geographic location.
In addition to the base salary, this role is eligible for additional elements of compensation including (cell allowances, annual bonus, or commissions etc.), as well as a comprehensive benefits plan.
Not sure if you qualify? Think about applying anyway:
We understand that not everyone brings 100% of the skills and experience for the role.
At Softchoice, we offer opportunities to a diverse group including those with a variety of workplace experiences and backgrounds. Whether you are new to corporate tech, returning to work after a gap in employment, or looking to transition and take the next step in your career, we are excited to learn more about you and encourage you to apply.
Why You’ll Love Working Here
The People: You’ll thrive in our collaborative environment, surrounded by incredible colleagues who foster support and innovation, driving our collective success 
High-Performing Culture: At Softchoice, we are dedicated to achieving our goals and committed to success for our customers and each other 
Flexibility: Plan your workdays in a way that suits you best 
Award-Winning Workplace: Proudly recognized as a Great Place to Work for 20 consecutive years 
Inclusive Culture: We are committed to an inclusive culture where every team member can be their authentic self 
Competitive Benefits: Benefit from competitive perks that start on day one 
Inclusion & Equal Opportunity Employment
We are an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, inclusion & belonging. People seeking employment at Softchoice are considered without regard to any protected category including but not limited to, race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.
Require accommodation? We are ready to help:
We are proud to provide interview & employment accommodation during the recruitment and hiring process. If you require any accommodation to apply or interview for a position, please reach out directly to asktalentacquisition@softchoice.com . We are committed to working with you to best meet your needs.
Our Commitment To Your Experience
We are committed to the safety of all applicants and team members. With that in mind, we have implemented digital interviewing for everyone. We understand that you may need to interview with distractions around you (such as children or furry friends) and we will be doing the same.
Before you start with us, we will conduct a criminal record check, verify your education, and check your references.
When you join Softchoice, we will onboard you remotely. Don't worry. It's quick, simple and you'll be connected with your new team in no time.

About The Job
Our Hubs are a crucial part of how we innovate, improving performance across every Sanofi department and providing a springboard for the amazing work we do. Build a career and you can be part of transforming our business while helping to change millions of lives.
As a Data Architect at Sanofi, you’ll play a pivotal role in driving our Digital transformation through innovative and scalable data architecture solutions. You’ll join the Digital Architecture Center of Excellence, Global Functions Architecture team, collaborating with stakeholders in the DDO (Digital Delivery and Operations) and BOT (Business Operations Transformation) Organizations and the Data AI & Governance teams to shape global data strategies and enable data-driven decision-making. As a Data Architect, you are a dynamic leader, looking to shape and drive data architecture on a global Enterprise level. This is your chance to harness cutting-edge tools and techniques to bring the miracles of science to life.
We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives. We’re also a company where you can flourish and grow your career, with countless opportunities to explore, make connections with people, and stretch the limits of what you thought was possible. Ready to get started?

Partner with Business Operations Transformation stakeholders to meet functional and analytical requirements.
Communicate and socialize the Data Mesh principles, to both technical and business stakeholders, fostering organizational buy-in.
Design data-sharing patterns to facilitate efficient, scalable, and flexible data exchange across systems, minimizing dependencies and enabling independent evolution of data-producing and data-consuming applications.
Collaborate on implementing data access and data stewardship frameworks that promote transparency, accountability, and adherence to governance policies.
Stay informed about advancements in data architecture and decentralized data management, identifying opportunities to enhance the organization’s data capabilities.
Promote a culture of innovation and continuous improvement in data architecture.

Why Choose Us?
Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team.
Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally.
Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact.

About the job
About Dialogue
Dialogue is the #1 virtual care provider in Canada. By developing our Integrated Health Platform🅫, we provide exceptional online health and wellness programs (primary care, mental health, iCBT, EAP, and wellness) to organizations that want to improve the wellness of their employees and families.
When It Comes To Our Work, We Set The Bar High. Together, We’re Transforming Health And Helping Millions Improve Their Well-being. We’re Firm Believers That Great People Don’t Settle On
Impact
Community
Growth
Excellence
Feel like you can make a difference? Good news, we saved you a seat!
Come as you are. As a proud equal-opportunity employer, Dialogue is dedicated to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. Qualified applicants will be considered regardless of citizenship, ethnicity, race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, age, or veteran status. Applicants who require specialized accommodation are encouraged to contact accessibility@dialogue.co.
AI Disclosure Statement
To ensure an efficient and fair review process, we utilize artificial intelligence tools to assist in the initial screening and assessment of applicants for this role.
Your role as an AI Integration Developer
As an AI Integration Developer in the Provider Stream group, you will be part of the team responsible for bridging advanced automation technologies with our clinical operations. The mission is to build the "Intelligent Provider" infrastructure—developing the systems that eliminate administrative burden and enhance clinical decision-making.
This role is a high-impact hybrid of AI and Backend Engineering. Responsibilities of this role include building secure, scalable pipelines that allow us to leverage the best existing solutions in a high-stakes medical environment. You will ensure that every automation is grounded, validated, and production-ready.
What You'll Be Doing
Scalable Backend Architecture: Design and maintain high-concurrency microservices and APIs that serve as the backbone for provider-facing automation tools.
Systems Integration: Architect robust "Agentic" workflows and integration layers to connect internal clinical data with external reasoning engines and automation services.
Infrastructure & DevOps: Manage the deployment, scaling, and reliability of integration services using containerization, CI/CD, and infrastructure-as-code.
Validation Frameworks: Build automated testing and evaluation pipelines to measure the accuracy, safety, and reliability of system outputs before they reach clinicians.
Security & Privacy: Implement rigorous data-masking and secure transmission protocols to ensure all integrations meet PHI (Protected Health Information) standards.
Observability: Develop deep monitoring and tracing for integrated systems to track performance, latency, and cost-efficiency.
We'd love to hear from you if you have
Strong Backend Core: 5+ years of experience in Python (FastAPI/Django) or similar languages, with a mastery of distributed systems and event-driven architecture.
DevOps Expertise: Proven experience with AWS (Bedrock, Lambda, ECS), Terraform, and Kubernetes to ensure system scalability and high availability.
Integration Experience: Practical knowledge of connecting disparate systems via REST/gRPC, managing rate-limits, and handling asynchronous task queues (e.g., Celery, Redis).
Validation & Quality Mindset: Experience building "Evaluation" systems—you believe in data-driven validation over manual "vibes-based" testing.
Security-First Approach: Deep understanding of securing cloud environments and handling sensitive data in a regulated industry (SOC2, HIPAA, or PIPEDA).
Bilingualism: Essential for validating and troubleshooting system outputs that serve both our French and English clinical staff.
Please note that as we serve customers across Canada, bilingualism is essential for this position. You may be required to communicate in French and English.
At Dialogue, your well-being is our priority
Benefits
Taking care of others also means taking care of our team! Depending on your role and employment status, you could have access to the following benefits:
Access to the Dialogue app and virtual mental health support for you and your family
Fully funded insurance, a health spending account, dental coverage, and fitness reimbursement
4 weeks vacation, 9 wellness days, and 1 volunteer day
Hybrid work: 3 days/week in our Montreal or Toronto offices, excluding remote roles
Work abroad up to 4 weeks/year

Learning via Coursera, external training budget & mentorship

Defining and influencing the service model, governance, and documentation.
Supporting day-to-day analytics needs for the business users (Sales, Marketing, Promotions etc)
Continuously developing the product roadmap to align with the business priorities

3-5+ years in digital or analytics product/project management (data/BI).

About the job
Powered by Passion. United by Purpose. Build for Impact.
At Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment Partnership (MLSE), we exist to deliver the ultimate fan experience by lifting trophies, spirits, and communities – united as one.
We're more than a workplace. We are a team of passionate people, boldly building the future of sport and entertainment, together. We believe in the power of play, the strength of collaboration, and the energy that comes from showing up with purpose.
From the ice to the pitch, the hardwood to the digital arena, we’re proud to be the driving force behind the Toronto Maple Leafs (NHL), the Toronto Raptors (NBA), Toronto FC (MLS), Toronto Argonauts (CFL) and development teams with the Toronto Marlies (AHL), Raptors 905 (NBA G League), Toronto FC II (MLS NEXT Pro League) and Raptors Uprising Gaming Club, the Toronto Raptors Esports franchise in the NBA 2K League. 
We bring these teams – and world-class entertainment – to life at our iconic venues, including Scotiabank Arena, BMO Field, Coca-Cola Coliseum, Ford Performance Centre, BMO Training Ground, and OVO Athletic Centre. Off the field, we serve up elevated dining at e11even, Real Sports, and our signature club spaces like Hot Stove Club, ScotiaClub, and Platinum Club.
Through MLSE Foundation and MLSE LaunchPad, we use the power of sport to help youth facing barriers reach their full potential. Since 2009, we’ve invested more than $45 million into Ontario communities -- and we’re just getting started. 
This is what it means to be One MLSE: a culture where everyone plays a role, everyone belongs, and everyone contributes to something bigger than themselves.
So, if you're ready to play with purpose, grow with passion, and win as one, we’d love to have you on our team.
 We know that great candidates come from a variety of backgrounds and experiences. Even if you do not meet every qualification listed, we encourage you to apply. Your unique perspective, transferable skills, and lived experience may be exactly what we’re looking for. **
Job Description
MLSE Sport Performance Lab is seeking a Product Engineer to join our team. This individual will bridge high-level product decisions with deep engineering execution. The ideal candidate will have hands-on full-stack development experience, while working within a product team focused on delivering data-driven tools to stakeholders. This role reports to the Manager of MLOps.
Sport Performance Lab is a research & development team focused on delivering wins for our professional teams, working with our front offices and coaching staffs. We value individuals who are eager to learn and collaborative within a diverse team of engineers, data scientists, and subject-matter experts.
Position Type: 12-month independent contract
Responsibilities
Design, build, and maintain full stack applications using React, Python, and AWS services (e.g., Lambda, API Gateway, S3, DynamoDB, ECS), while collaborating with DevOps and infrastructure teams to implement secure, scalable deployment pipelines (e.g., GitHub Actions).
Build RESTful APIs and backend services that integrate with frontend interfaces and data pipelines.
Provide development support for iOS apps using React Native/Swift
Contribute to AI/ML-driven features by integrating models or supporting real-time insights.
Collaborate with cross-discipline teams, such as infrastructure and application engineering, to define metadata layers, technical strategies, and efficient integration across the existing landscape.
Provide high-level sizing estimates and contribute to planning and scoping discussions to ensure alignment on technical solutions, project goals, and prioritization.
Communicate and document complex technical tradeoffs (e.g. latency, accuracy, cost) to non-technical stakeholders and support collaborative, holistic decision making
Develop and implement testing solutions, including automation, to ensure application quality and reliability.
Qualifications
Minimum 1-2 years of experience in full stack development.
Proficiency working with AWS services (e.g., Lambda, S3, DynamoDB, ECS, API Gateway).
Experience with React (or similar frontend framework) and Python for backend/API development.
Familiarity with DevOps and CI/CD best practices (e.g., GitHub Actions, Docker).
Experience building and consuming RESTful APIs; familiarity with GraphQL is a plus.
Understanding of SDLC and version control workflows (Git, pull requests, code reviews).
Strong problem-solving, debugging, and code optimization skills.
Interest in AI/ML concepts, especially around model integration or intelligent features.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team and effectively manage multiple priorities.
Nice-to-haves
Exposure to React Native, Swift, or other mobile development frameworks.
Experience with data visualization tools or libraries (e.g., D3.js, Recharts).
Experience with sports data or knowledge of the sports industry.
Familiarity with model deployment workflows (e.g., SageMaker).
Previous experience working with confidential data or information.

About the job
Lieu De Travail
Toronto, Ontario, Canada
Horaire
37.5
Secteur D’activité
Données et Analyses
Détails De La Rémunération
$96,900 - $136,800 CAD
La TD a à cœur d’offrir une rémunération juste et équitable à tous les collègues. Les occasions de croissance et le perfectionnement des compétences sont des caractéristiques essentielles de l’expérience collègue à la TD. Nos politiques et pratiques en matière de rémunération ont été conçues pour permettre aux collègues de progresser dans l’échelle salariale au fil du temps, à mesure qu’ils s’améliorent dans leurs fonctions. Le salaire de base offert peut varier en fonction des compétences et de l’expérience du candidat, de ses connaissances professionnelles, de son emplacement géographique et d’autres besoins particuliers du secteur et de l’entreprise.
En tant que candidat, nous vous encourageons à poser des questions sur la rémunération et à avoir une conversation franche avec votre recruteur, qui pourra vous fournir des détails plus précis sur ce poste.
Description Du Poste
Are you ready to take the reins in the ever-evolving world of data and business intelligence? TD is searching for a visionary leader to spearhead our next generation of data solutions. This is your moment to drive real change - championing automation, leveraging the latest in analytics, and empowering teams to deliver insights that transform how we do business. If you crave a fast-paced environment where your ideas spark innovation and your leadership unlocks new opportunities, we want you on our team!
Key Accountabilities
Lead & Inspire: Build and energize dynamic, cross-functional teams of data and business information professionals, fostering a culture of collaboration and excellence.
Deliver Impact: Create high-value data products and compelling presentations using cutting-edge tools like Power BI and Co-pilot—always on time, always to spec.
Champion Automation: Bring efficiency and innovation to reporting and integration through Python scripting, automating workflows and streamlining processes.
Empower Leadership: Provide actionable insights to business segment leaders with world-class information and analytics capabilities.
Break Down Barriers: Integrate siloed and external data sources to enable predictive analytics and deeper understanding of customer behaviour.
Pioneer Innovation: Continuously advance analytics tools and methodologies, always searching for ways to automate, optimize, and visualize data in new ways.
Shareholder Value
Set the Standard: Lead the delivery of best-in-class Business Information Management solutions, supporting data needs across enterprise projects.
Guard Integrity: Uphold rigorous data management and governance, proactively tackling risks and ensuring compliance with TD’s highest standards.
Be the Expert: Guide cross-functional initiatives, provide trusted advice in complex situations, and keep TD ahead of emerging trends and regulatory shifts.
Drive Progress: Lead remediation, promote risk management, and champion a culture of continuous improvement and accountability.
Employee Experience
Grow & Develop: Master automation, Python scripting, Power BI, and Co-pilot, with support for ongoing learning and professional advancement.
Build Community: Foster a high-performing, inclusive environment where sharing ideas, open communication, and team growth are always celebrated.
Be a Change Agent: Encourage a positive, agile workplace where challenges are met head-on and solutions are recognized.
Champion TD: Serve as an ambassador for our business—internally and externally—embodying TD’s values and leadership.
Breadth & Depth
Technical Mastery: Demonstrate expert knowledge across business technical environments—user applications, software, hardware, programming (Python) and analytics platforms (Power BI, Co-pilot).
Subject Matter Leadership: Be the go-to expert across multiple data domains, consulting on research, design, solutions and testing.
Strategic Impact: Shape and evolve business information management discipline and strategy, leading solutions for medium-term (6–12 months) challenges.
Senior Partnership: Report directly to senior management or executive leadership, influencing direction at the highest levels.
Qualifications & Experience
Undergraduate degree or Technical Certificate required; graduate degree preferred.
Minimum 7+ years of relevant experience in business administration, statistical, mathematical, scientific or financial fields.
Proven expertise in business information management, data analysis and governance.
Strong hands-on experience with automation, Python scripting and process improvement.
Advanced proficiency in Power BI for data visualization and dashboard reporting.
Solid understanding of Co-pilot and other modern AI-powered productivity tools.
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilities, thriving in fast-paced, collaborative environments.
If you’re ready to lead the way in business information management, drive automation and shape the next generation of analytics at TD, apply now! Your expertise will fuel the future of data-driven decision making—join us and make your mark.
À propos de nous
La TD est un chef de file mondial dans le secteur des institutions financières. Elle représente la cinquième banque en Amérique du Nord de par son nombre de succursales. Chaque jour, nous offrons une expérience client légendaire à plus de 27 millions de ménages et d’entreprises au Canada, aux États-Unis et partout dans le monde. Plus de 95 000 collègues de la TD mettent en commun leurs compétences, leur talent et leur créativité au service de la Banque, des clients qu’elle sert et des économies qu’elle appuie. Nous sommes guidés par notre vision d’être une meilleure banque et par notre objectif d’enrichir la vie de nos clients, de nos collectivités et de nos collègues.
La TD est une entreprise profondément engagée à être une leader en matière d’expérience client. Voilà pourquoi nous croyons que chaque collègue, peu importe son secteur d’activité, est en contact avec la clientèle. En parallèle de l’évolution de nos activités et de notre stratégie, nous innovons afin d’améliorer l’expérience client et de créer des capacités pour façonner l’avenir des services bancaires. Que vous ayez plusieurs années d’expérience dans le secteur bancaire ou que vous commenciez tout juste votre carrière dans le domaine des services financiers, nous pouvons vous aider à réaliser votre plein potentiel. Vous pourrez compter sur nos programmes de formation et de mentorat et sur des conversations sur le perfectionnement et le leadership pour réaliser votre plein potentiel et atteindre vos objectifs. Notre croissance en tant qu’entreprise rime avec la vôtre.
Notre programme de rémunération globale
Notre programme de rémunération globale reflète les investissements que nous faisons pour aider nos collègues et leur famille à atteindre leurs objectifs en matière de bien-être mental, physique et financier. La rémunération globale à la TD inclut le salaire de base, la rémunération variable et bien d’autres régimes clés, comme des avantages sociaux en matière de santé et de bien-être, des régimes d’épargne et de retraite, des congés payés, des avantages bancaires et des rabais, des occasions de développement de carrière et des programmes de récompenses et reconnaissance. En savoir plus
Renseignements Supplémentaires
Nous sommes ravis que vous envisagiez une carrière à la TD. Sachez que nous avons à cœur d’aider nos collègues à réussir dans leur vie tant personnelle que professionnelle. C’est d’ailleurs pourquoi nous leur offrons des conversations sur le perfectionnement, des programmes de formation et un régime d’avantages sociaux concurrentiel.
Perfectionnement des collègues 
Un cheminement professionnel particulier vous intéresse ou vous cherchez à acquérir certaines compétences? Nous tenons à vous mettre sur la voie de la réussite. Vous aurez des conversations régulières sur le développement de carrière, le perfectionnement et le rendement avec votre gestionnaire. Une variété de programmes de mentorat et une plateforme d’apprentissage en ligne seront également à votre disposition pour vous aider à ouvrir de nouvelles portes. Que vous ayez à cœur d’aider les clients et souhaitiez élargir votre expérience ou que vous préfériez coacher et inspirer vos collègues, sachez que la TD propose un grand nombre de cheminements professionnels et qu’elle s’engage à vous aider à relever les occasions qui vont dans le sens de vos objectifs.
Formation et intégration
Nous tenons à nous assurer que vous disposez des outils et ressources nécessaires pour réussir à votre nouveau poste. Dans cette optique, nous organiserons des séances d’intégration et de formation.
Processus d’entrevue 
Nous communiquerons avec les candidats sélectionnés pour planifier une entrevue. Nous ferons notre possible pour communiquer par courriel ou par téléphone avec tous les candidats pour leur faire part de notre décision.
Mesures d’adaptation
L’accessibilité est importante pour nous. N’hésitez pas à nous faire part de toute mesure d’adaptation (salles de réunion accessibles, sous-titres pour les entrevues virtuelles, etc.) dont vous pourriez avoir besoin pour participer sans entraves au processus d’entrevue.
Nous avons hâte d’avoir de vos nouvelles!

SHAREHOLDER

EMPLOYEE / TEAM
Participate fully as a member of the team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues/ points of interest.

Job Description:
About the job
22 Jan 2026
Coke Canada Bottling is Canada’s Local Bottler. We’re Made Local.
Facility and main work Location - King St, Toronto, ON
This role can be hybrid and in office Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday or Work From Home in Ontario
Salary - The base salary for this position is from $103,500- $143,750. The starting base salary is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, role complexity, experience and internal equity.
Initial Posting Close Date - Dec 5, 2025 *extended until January 28th, 2026
Proudly independent, we are a Canadian, family-owned business. Coke Canada Bottling makes, distributes, merchandises, and sells the most-loved beverages Canadians enjoy. With over 6,000 diverse employees coast-to-coast, we operate in every province through 50+ sales and distribution centres, and five manufacturing facilities. Coke Canada supplies some of Canada’s favourite beverage brands, and we want to continue to be the leading beverage partner in Canada, creating a better future and delivering optimism by bringing sustainable value to our employees, customers, consumers, and communities. For more information about Coke Canada Bottling and our products, visit cokecanada.com/our-product.
Advancing a high-performing, collaborative and inclusive culture is at the core of our Vision to be the World’s Greatest Bottler, Built by the Best People, and we’re looking for exceptional talent to help get us there.
About This Opportunity
Reporting to the Director, Intelligent Data and Enterprise Automation, the Data Architect will shape and guide the data architecture behind our Unified Data Platform, the foundation for harmonized, AI-ready, enterprise-wide data. You’ll be a connector and a builder, bridging technology strategy with real-world execution. You’ll collaborate across business, analytics, and engineering teams to design scalable, secure, and future-ready data patterns that unlock analytics, automation, and machine learning.
This is an exciting opportunity to join a supportive, forward-thinking team that values creativity, speed, and impact, and to play a central role in Coke Canada’s AI and automation journey.
Responsibilities
Elevate and evolve enterprise data architecture principles, models, and patterns that support Coke Canada’s Unified Data Platform and AI-readiness roadmap.
Design and develop logical and physical models, data domains, lineage, and integration frameworks across raw, base, dimensional, and gold layers (Fabric / Snowflake / OneLake ecosystem).
Foster interoperability by partnering with Data Engineering and Application teams to design reusable ingestion frameworks, data APIs, and integration patterns that empower enterprise-wide reuse. 
Collaborate closely with Master Data, Cyber Security, and Data Governance to uphold standards for data quality, security, and privacy.
Build architecture components enabling AI / ML (feature stores, model data feeds, metadata services, data catalogs).
Shape modernization efforts, guiding migration strategies from legacy systems to our new Unified Data Platform.
Engage with business stakeholders to translate use cases into scalable solutions (sales, supply chain, operations analytics, etc.).
Contribute to governance forums and mentor technical teams on best practices and design patterns. 
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a closely related field.
At least 8 years of experience in data architecture, modelling, and data engineering with enterprise-scale systems.
Expertise in data modelling (conceptual, logical, physical), ETL / ELT design, and data integration (REST, API, event streams).
Deep knowledge of cloud data platforms (Azure Fabric, Snowflake, Databricks preferred) and modern data warehouse / lake / mesh architectures.
Experience with data governance, metadata management, lineage, and data quality frameworks.
Proven success implementing scalable data solutions enabling analytics and automation.
Strong communication skills to translate technical design into business value and to influence cross-functional leaders.

About the job
About Us: 
At Lemurian Labs, we’re reimagining the foundations of computing to make AI accessible to everyone. Our mission is to remove the limits of scale, hardware, and cost that hold back innovation, so the people solving humanity’s hardest problems can move faster.
We’re building a new kind of software stack: a hardware-agnostic platform that makes every system - from a laptop to a supercomputer - feel like one seamless engine. Developers can write once, run anywhere, and get state-of-the-art performance across any chip, any cloud, any scale. It’s a complete rethink of how software and hardware interact—designed for the era beyond Moore’s Law.
We’re not looking for the comfortable or the conventional; we’re looking for the bold. The engineers who crave frontier problems, who want to bend the limits of what’s possible, who see infrastructure not as a constraint but as a canvas. If you want to build the foundation for the next era of AI, and change what humanity can achieve in the process, join us.
About Us: 
We're looking for a Technical Product Manager who will work closely with our founders to shape, design, and execute the product strategy behind our next-gen AI platform. 
This is not a typical PM role. You’ll be working at the intersection of compilers, distributed runtimes, and developer experience, translating frontier technology into products that redefine how developers and enterprises train and serve AI models at scale. You will collaborate with teams cross-functionally to define what gets built, why it matters, and how it benefits our customers. 
You will be responsible for driving clarity in times of ambiguity, scoping complex work, validating product hypotheses, defining testable outcomes, and other related tasks. This is a high-impact, zero-to-one role for someone who thrives on building deeply technical products from first principles and wants to help reshape the future of AI infrastructure. 
You will want this role if you’re someone who loves operating at the edge of technology, product, and design, while obsessing over architecture, user experience, and adoption, and who wants to leave a lasting impact on how the world builds and deploys AI
What You'll Do
Identify and analyze AI workloads across various industries, understanding the infrastructure needs for large-scale model builders and enterprise AI teams
Define strategies for optimizing AI workloads using Lemurian's software stack, ensuring seamless integration with existing tools
Work closely with engineering teams to build products that accelerate AI development and deployment
Engage directly with enterprise AI teams, model builders, and developers to gather insights and translate them into impactful product features
Collaborate cross-functionally with engineering, marketing, and sales to ensure alignment and drive successful product adoption
Define and track key metrics to measure the impact of Lemurian's AI software solutions and drive continuous improvements
Stay current with the latest advancements in AI infrastructure, frameworks, and platforms to inform product decisions
Develop and execute go-to-market strategies for AI software products that leverage Lemurian's compiler and optimization capabilities
What You'll Bring
6+ years of product management experience in AI, cloud platforms, or developer tools
Deep understanding of AI model development, inference, and training platforms
Experience with AI workloads and infrastructure requirements for large-scale deployments
Strong technical knowledge of compilers, AI frameworks (TensorFlow/JAX, PyTorch, Triton, XLA, etc.), and cloud-native technologies
Ability to translate customer needs into actionable product features and drive execution in collaboration with engineering teams
Excellent communication skills with a proven ability to engage with technical and non-technical stakeholders
Track record of shipping successful products in fast-paced environments
Nice to have
Prior experience working in a high-growth startup environment
Hands-on experience with Python programming
Familiarity with cloud-native technologies (Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform) and optimization techniques for scalable AI workloads
Experience with GPU architectures and performance optimization
Background in developer tools or infrastructure products
Contributions to open-source AI or infrastructure projects
Personal Attributes
Customer-obsessed — you deeply understand user needs and build products people love
Self-driven — you take ownership and don't wait for permission to solve problems
Collaborative mindset — you work well across teams and help others succeed
Passionate about sustainability — you care about making AI more efficient and environmentally responsible
Clear communicator — you can explain complex technical concepts to both engineers and stakeholders
Strategic thinker — you balance long-term vision with near-term execution
Salary depends on experience and geographical location. 
This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, such as the candidate’s experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity among our team. 
Additional benefits for this role may include: equity, company bonus opportunities, medical, dental, and vision benefits; retirement savings plan; and supplemental wellness benefits.
Lemurian Labs ensures equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

About the job
Why Mozilla?
Mozilla Corporation is the non-profit-backed technology company that has shaped the internet for the better over the last 25 years. We make pioneering brands like Firefox, the privacy-minded web browser. Now, with more than 225 million people around the world using our products each month, we’re shaping the next 25 years of technology and helping to reclaim an internet built for people, not companies. Our work focuses on diverse areas including AI, social media, security and more. And we’re doing this while never losing our focus on our core mission – to make the internet better for people.
The Mozilla Corporation is wholly owned by the non-profit 501(c) Mozilla Foundation. This means we aren’t beholden to any shareholders — only to our mission. Along with thousands of volunteer contributors and collaborators all over the world, Mozillians design, build and distribute open-source software that enables people to enjoy the internet on their terms.
About This Team And Role
Mozilla is seeking a Staff Software Engineer to lead the next evolution of Service Desk and digital workplace operations. This role goes beyond traditional IT support: it is centered on AI-driven service enablement, automation, and platform ownership.  
You will be a single-threaded owner for key internal platforms and Enterprise AI-powered services, ensuring they deliver maximum value to the business. You’ll architect intelligent workflows, integrate SaaS and AI systems, and drive adoption across the organization — all while staying connected to the user experience through escalations, feedback loops, and advanced troubleshooting.  
This is a lead-level role for someone who thrives at the intersection of technology, AI, security, and human experience — with deep experience in high-end Python scripting to build, scale, and maintain automation frameworks and integrations across Mozilla’s internal tools ecosystem.
What You’ll Do
Roll out new collaboration and Enterprise GenAI capabilities: run pilots, manage change/comms, create guides, and deliver training that drives adoption and safety.
Design and ship automations (scripts, workflows, chatbots, AI agents) to streamline provisioning/deprovisioning, entitlements, group lifecycle, and tier-1 deflection.
Build monitoring and alerting for SaaS health and key workflows; lead incident, problem, and change practices to reduce MTTR and prevent recurrences.
Define SLAs/SLOs, instrument CSAT and operational metrics, and run regular service reviews that turn data into improvements.
Serve as technical escalation for complex tickets: drive resolution, perform root-cause analysis, and capture knowledge to uplevel the Service Desk.
Maintain clean, current documentation: runbooks, KB articles, architecture diagrams, and admin playbooks.
Champion a 'shift-left' model: expand self-service portals, guided flows, and AI virtual agents to improve velocity and user experience.
Enterprise AI Security & Governance: implement guardrails for AI/automation usage, including access controls, data handling policies, compliance alignment, and ongoing risk monitoring.
Cross-Functional Partnership: collaborate with People, Security, Finance, Legal, and Procurement to ensure platforms align with organizational goals.
Vendor & Contract Management: lead relationships with SaaS and AI providers, negotiate terms, and ensure strong ROI.
Mentor & Lead: coach P3 engineers in automation, AI prompt engineering, and scalable integration design.
What You’ll Bring
7+ years in IT engineering, enterprise applications, or service delivery.
ITIL 4 Foundations certification (required).
Comfortable leading incident, problem, and change management (ITIL), measuring SLAs/SLOs, and using data to drive continuous service improvements.
Demonstrated success owning platforms end-to-end, including lifecycle management, integrations, and adoption.
Advanced proficiency in Python scripting — with proven experience developing, optimizing, and maintaining automation frameworks, APIs/webhooks, and integration logic across enterprise tools.
Strong automation & scripting skills in one or more of: Python; with experience building APIs/webhooks, workflow engines, and chatbots.
Advanced experience in AI & automation platforms (GenAI copilots, RPA, intelligent workflows), including security and governance guardrails for safe adoption.
A builder’s mindset: bias for automation and documentation, empathy for end users, and a willingness to mentor Service Desk colleagues.
Strong program/project management skills with proven ability to independently deliver initiatives.
Ability to translate ambiguous business needs into structured, scalable solutions.
Leadership presence and credibility with executives and peers.
High tolerance for ambiguity with skill in bringing clarity and structure.
What You’ll Get
Generous performance-based bonus plans to all eligible employees - we share in our success as one team
Rich medical, dental, and vision coverage
Generous retirement contributions with 100% immediate vesting (regardless of whether you contribute)
Quarterly all-company wellness days where everyone takes a pause together
Country specific holidays plus a day off for your birthday
One-time home office stipend
Annual professional development budget
Quarterly well-being stipend
Considerable paid parental leave
Employee referral bonus program
Other benefits (life/AD&D, disability, EAP, etc. - varies by country)
About Mozilla
Mozilla exists to build the Internet as a public resource accessible to all because we believe that open and free is better than closed and controlled. When you work at Mozilla, you give yourself a chance to make a difference in the lives of Web users everywhere. And you give us a chance to make a difference in your life every single day. Join us to work on the Web as the platform and help create more opportunity and innovation for everyone online.
Commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging
Mozilla understands that valuing diverse creative practices and forms of knowledge are crucial to and enrich the company’s core mission. WELCOME TO VCNA!

Our commitment to excellence can be seen in those who invest and believe in what we do, those who share their lives with us, those who trust in our deliveries and those committed to innovation and a sustainable future.
Every day, we have the chance to accomplish something new and you're invited to be part of it.
WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Analyst with hands-on experience in Palantir Foundry to join our Data Analytics team. The ideal candidate will play a key role in designing, developing, and optimizing scalable data pipelines and applications that drive impactful business decisions.
WHAT WILL YOU DO?
Working closely with the business areas and the IT team, the Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for the following:
 Design, implement, and maintain robust data pipelines and ETL/ELT workflows.

 Develop and maintain geospatial databases, analyses, and applications.
 Design and implement machine learning models, and statistical analyses.
 Contribute to governance, security, and compliance practices in data handling.

 Collaborate with data driven initiatives, and innovation projects.

 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
 5+ years of experience in data analysis, data engineering, or a related role.
 Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
 Experience with Palantir Foundry and its tools (Ontology Manager, Workshop, Pipeline Builder, Contour, etc.), and/or with other data platforms (Databricks, Snowflake, Fabric, Looker, Tableau, PBI)
 Strong programming skills in Python, Typescript, and/or similar languages.
 Expert knowledge in SQL and data modeling techniques.
 Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, or GCP) and ERP systems.
 Knowledge of big data tools (Spark, Hadoop) and versioning control tools.
 Experience with geospatial, and ML/LLM tools and workflows

Salary: Please note the base salary for this role is $120,000 CAD
Job Description:
About the job
BMO Capital Markets is a leading, full-service financial services provider. We offer corporate and investment banking, treasury management, as well as research and advisory services to clients around the world. #bmocapitalmarkets
About the Role:
We’re looking for a pragmatic, detail-oriented Software Engineer to help build and maintain our Quantitative Investment Strategy (QIS) Calculation Engine — the core platform that powers the calculation of quantitative indices (levels and decompositions), risk modeling, scenario analysis and prototyping across Global Markets. You’ll work across a modern C# codebase with critical Python interop for research pipelines, numerical routines, quick prototyping, backtesting, and data science tooling. Expect to collaborate closely with quants, traders, and software engineers to deliver resilient, event driven, auditable systems at scale.
What You’ll Do:
Own the engine: Design, implement, and optimize components of the QIS engine (e.g., factor models, signal pipelines, backtesting, scenario analysis, portfolio optimization).
Interop & integrations: Build robust C#/Python interop layers (Pythonnet or equivalent) to bridge production services with research scripts generated by quant team.
Data engineering for quant: Develop reliable market data ingestion, normalization, and metadata/versioning (symbols, corporate actions).
Performance & reliability: Profile and tune CPU/memory, parallelism (TPL/async), caching, and I/O; ensure deterministic, reproducible runs with comprehensive logging and telemetry.
Model lifecycle management: Operationalize quant models—parameterization, configuration, feature flags, release management, and controlled experiment frameworks.
Testing & quality: Implement rigorous unit/integration tests, regression suites against golden datasets, and CI/CD pipelines.
Risk & compliance: Embed controls for auditability, explainability, and traceability of results; support model validation and governance that conforms to BMO standards.
Collaboration: Partner with quants on specification and model translation; work with team on deployment, observability, and production incident response.
Qualifications
Must-have
3+ years professional software engineering experience in C#/.NET building production services/libraries.
Previous experience in Python with an emphasis on Python internals.
Strong knowledge of software architecture and distributed systems: APIs, messaging, concurrency, resiliency patterns, configuration management.
Hands-on experience with Python for numerical computing (NumPy, pandas, SciPy).
Solid CS fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, complexity analysis, threads/async, networking, serialization.
Database experience: RDMS (PostgreSQL/MSSQL) fundamentals as well as experience in building queries, database design and optimizing/tuning DB for performance.
Familiarity with market data: time series, corporate actions, calendars, B-PIPE.
Nice-to-have
Experience in finance: quantitative investment models, factor investing, portfolio optimization (e.g., mean-variance, risk parity), transaction cost modeling.
Performance profiling (BenchmarkDotNet, dotTrace, perf counters), and high-performance C# (Span/Memory, SIMD, channels).
Experience with on-prem infrastructure (dedicated VMs, Ansible, etc...), secrets management, and observability (OpenTelemetry, Prometheus/Grafana, ELK).
Exposure to modern C# features (.NET 8+), and design patterns for domain-driven design.
Database experience: columnar/time-series stores (Parquet/Delta/InfluxDB/Kdb+/OneTick) a plus.
Proficiency in testing and CI/CD: xUnit/NUnit, test containers, GitHub Actions/Azure DevOps or similar.
What Success Looks Like (6–12 Months)
Enhance the QIS engine’s index calculation throughput and increase the speed at which new indices can be added within the engine
Deliver a clean interop layer with clear contracts and automated validation between Python and production C#.
Develop and ship at least one new quantitative investment strategy with demonstrable notional attribution.
Our Tech Stack
Core: C#/.NET 8 with ASP.NET Core, on-prem VMs, IIS
Interop: Python (NumPy/pandas/SciPy) with Pythonnet
Tooling: Azure DevOps, OpenTelemetry
Testing: xUnit/NUnit
Why Join Us
Impact at scale: Your work powers real strategies, capital deployment, and risk decisions across Global Markets.
R&D velocity: Tight feedback loops with quants and traders; pragmatic engineering over theory.
Modern stack & autonomy: Greenfield opportunities; strong ownership and room to innovate.
Please note the base salary for this role is $120,000 CAD

Job Description:
About the job
Who are we?
Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company®, shortening the path to connectivity to enable the innovations that enrich our work, life and planet.
A place where tech thinkers and future builders turn bold ideas into breakthrough experiences, we welcome your unique perspective.
Help us challenge assumptions, uncover bias, and remove barriers—because progress starts with fresh ideas. You’ll find belonging, purpose, and a team that welcomes you—because when you feel valued, you’re empowered to do your best work.
Job Summary
Designs, builds, and maintains customer-facing services and user interfaces. The role partners closely with product managers and other stakeholders to understand business needs, shape technical solutions, and deliver high-quality capabilities across the full stack. This engineer also contributes to AI/ML–related efforts—such as integrating models, evaluating tools, or building data-driven features—while continuing to support broader engineering projects.
Responsibilities
Requirements & Discovery
Collaborates with Product Managers and stakeholders to clarify objectives, constraints, and desired outcomes
Translates business needs into technical approaches, identifying risks, dependencies, and edge cases early
Provides clear, actionable feedback that helps refine priorities and solution direction
Architecture and System Design
Leads design for major features, projects, and cross-system integrations
Contributes to and reviews architectural decisions across backend, frontend, and shared services
Drives consistency in patterns, data modeling, error handling, and observability across the codebase
Development
Designs, implements, and maintains backend services using server-side frameworks, strongly typed languages, and scalable data storage technologies
Builds and enhances frontend applications using component-based frameworks, client-side tooling, and microfrontend or modular UI architectures
Integrates AI/ML capabilities into existing systems when needed (e.g., inference APIs, vector search, model-driven features, data transformations)
Writes clean, maintainable, and well-tested code; actively participates in and leads peer code reviews
Improves code quality by adopting effective patterns, modern tooling, and appropriate linting and formatting standards
Quality and Reliability
Develops unit, integration, and cross-functional tests; recommends and adopts new testing frameworks
Works with associated infrastructure to ensure system reliability and performance
Troubleshoots and resolves Level 2 and Level 3 production issues; upholds operational SLAs

We are a leading Canadian financial services co-operative committed to being a catalyst for a sustainable and resilient society and our team is essential to deliver on this strategy. That’s why we prioritize our people, to ensure we provide a strong culture and development opportunities which enables our team to thrive and to live our purpose. Our Business Intelligence team empowers decision making using leading edge science and analytics. We champion a scientific culture through our passion for continuous learning, diversity and innovation. We strive to deliver a single version of truth, by providing our business partners with access to comprehensive data and valuable insights to help our organization achieve operational excellence. 
As the Lead Data Integration Specialist, you will lead various initiatives by engineering data solutions for analytics purposes while also supporting the team through coaching using insurance data and advanced programming tools. You will be responsible for providing business value through the creation; maintenance; implementation of back-end data solutions (ie. Source System Data Store & Business Data Store) through the full software development lifecycle and effectively communicate said value to a business audience.
How You Will Create Impact

About the job
Senior Big Data Developer (Scala/Spark Focus)
Company: Cogency
Location: Toronto, ON (Hybrid – 4 Days In-Office)
Position Type: Full-Time
The Opportunity
Cogency is seeking a Senior Big Data Developer to architect and build high-performance data ecosystems for a Major Tier-1 Financial Institution. You will be responsible for engineering scalable, distributed systems that handle massive datasets, ensuring that critical financial data is processed with precision and speed. This role focuses heavily on Apache Spark and Scala, pushing the boundaries of real-time streaming and batch processing in a cloud-native environment.
Key Responsibilities
Data Pipeline Engineering: Design and develop end-to-end, scalable ETL pipelines using Apache Spark. You will process and transform large-scale structured, semi-structured, and unstructured datasets from diverse sources.
Real-Time & Event-Driven Processing: Build real-time streaming solutions using Spark Structured Streaming. Manage event-driven architectures and complex integrations with message brokers like Kafka.
Big Data Framework Mastery: Leverage the full Hadoop ecosystem (HDFS, Hive, HBase, Kafka) to implement robust data ingestion frameworks.
Performance Tuning: Optimize Spark jobs for maximum scalability and resource utilization. You will debug distributed processing bottlenecks and implement advanced partitioning, caching, and shuffling techniques.
Data Modeling & Storage: Design efficient data models for distributed systems. Manage storage strategies across HDFS, Amazon S3, or Azure Blob Storage, ensuring total data integrity and consistency.
Workflow Automation: Orchestrate complex data lifecycles using tools like Apache Airflow, Oozie, or Azure Data Factory to ensure seamless job scheduling and dependency management.
Monitoring & Security: Implement proactive logging, alerting, and monitoring for production pipelines. Ensure all solutions meet rigorous enterprise security standards, including encryption at rest/motion and compliance with GDPR/regulatory policies.
Collaborative Innovation: Partner with Data Scientists and Analysts to translate business requirements into technical designs. Maintain high code quality through rigorous Scala unit testing and peer reviews.
What do you need to succeed?
Must-Have:
Advanced Spark Proficiency: Deep expertise in Spark Core, SQL, Streaming, and MLlib.
Scala Specialist: Strong programming skills in Scala (as the primary language for existing applications), with additional proficiency in Java or Python.
Ecosystem Experience: Hands-on experience with Hadoop, Hive, and Kafka in a production environment.
Cloud Fluency: Familiarity with Big Data services on cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
Distributed Systems Knowledge: Solid understanding of parallel processing, data warehousing, and database design.
Nice-to-Have:
Machine Learning: Experience with ML frameworks and libraries.
Modern DevOps: Knowledge of CI/CD for data pipelines, including Docker and Kubernetes orchestration.
Transformation Background: Experience migrating legacy data workloads to modern distributed cloud environments.
Working Conditions
Location: Toronto .
Schedule: This position requires a hybrid commitment of 4 days per week in-office to facilitate real-time collaboration with the engineering and architecture teams.

Job Title: Début de carrière : Associé données et analyses, Services professionnels
Salary: La fourchette de salaire pour ce poste est de 67 000 $ - 73 500 $
Job Description:
About the job
Vous souhaitez acquérir une expérience professionnelle précieuse dans un environnement de conseil dynamique dans le domaine de l’assurance IARD (assurance dommages)? Notre équipe de la pratique des Services professionnels recherche un associé en données et analyses pour rejoindre l’équipe à Montréal (Québec), Toronto (Ontario), Calgary (Alberta) ou Vancouver (Colombie-Britannique).
Les candidats doivent être légalement autorisés à travailler au Canada. Ce poste n’est pas admissible au parrainage et nous ne sommes pas en mesure de parrainer ou de participer à un parrainage pour l’obtention d’un visa d’emploi ou d’un permis de travail.
La fourchette de salaire pour ce poste est de 67 000 $ - 73 500 $. Le salaire réel variera en fonction de la formation, de l'expérience, des compétences et des aptitudes du candidat, ainsi que de l'équité interne. Aon vous offre également un ensemble complet d'avantages sociaux.
Aon aide les entreprises à prendre de meilleures décisions
Chez Aon, nous contribuons à une meilleure prise de décisions afin de protéger et d’enrichir la vie des gens dans le monde entier.
En tant qu’organisation, nous sommes unis par la confiance en une équipe inclusive, et nous sommes passionnés par la réussite de nos employés et de nos clients.
À quoi pourrez-vous vous attendre au quotidien?
Aider au calcul des ratio de sinistres pour le secteur (comptables, avocats, conseillers), par assureur et par entreprise;
Créer des tableaux de bord et des visualisations;
Analyser les tendances en matière de sinistres dans le secteur;
Analyser les tendances des taux de prime dans le secteur;
Comparer les limites, les franchises, les primes;
Participer aux réunions et discussions stratégiques avec les clients;
Aider l’équipe actuarielle dans la modélisation des pertes et l’évaluation des risques;
Ainsi que toute autre tâche connexe et pertinente non mentionnée précédemment.
En quoi cette offre d’emploi est-elle différente des autres?
L’équipe d’Aon de la pratique des Services professionnels se consacre exclusivement à servir les grands cabinets comptables, cabinets d’avocats et firmes d’experts-conseil internationaux, américains et canadiens, ainsi que leurs captives. Notre capacité à quantifier les risques liés à la responsabilité professionnelle de nos clients permet à Aon de concevoir une structure de programme optimale pour nos clients et de les aider dans leur prise de décision en matière de rétention, de financement et de transfert du risque. Pour plus de renseignements sur notre équipe, rendez-vous sur : https://www.aon.com/risk-services/services-professionnels/actuarial-risk-analysis.jsp
Compétences et expérience qui mèneront au succès
Une expérience professionnelle antérieure en analyse de données et du domaine de l’assurance est un atout.
D’excellentes compétences en anglais (écrit et oral) sont requises.
De solides compétences en mathématiques et en analyse.
De solides compétences interpersonnelles, attitude positive et capacité à travailler en équipe.
La capacité d’expliquer des concepts complexes de manière simple et efficace à un public non initié.
Une personne ingénieuse et stratégique, capable de résoudre les problèmes et de proposer des solutions pratiques.
Elle doit démontrer clairement sa compétence en matière d’attention portée aux détails.
Elle possède d’excellentes compétences organisationnelles — capacité à travailler sur plusieurs tâches et à établir des priorités.
La maîtrise de MS Office (Word et Excel) est un atout.
Une expérience avec @Risk, VBA et/ou R est un atout.
Formation
Baccalauréat en informatique, statistiques, science des données, mathématiques ou dans un domaine similaire.
Ce que nous faisons pour soutenir nos employés
En plus de notre programme complet d’avantages sociaux, nous favorisons une main-d’œuvre inclusive. Également, notre environnement agile vous permet de gérer votre bien-être et de concilier vie professionnelle et vie privée, afin que vous puissiez donner le meilleur de vous-même chez Aon. Qui plus est, tous les employés participent chaque année à deux journées de bien-être mondiales, qui les encouragent à prendre le temps de s’occuper d’eux-mêmes. Nous proposons également à nos employés divers modes de travail.
Notre culture de formation continue vous inspire et vous donne les moyens d’apprendre, de partager et de vous perfectionner, pour vous aider à atteindre votre plein potentiel. Par conséquent, chez Aon, vous êtes plus connecté, plus pertinent et plus valorisé.
Aon valorise un lieu de travail innovateur et inclusif, où tous les employés sont encouragés à être eux-mêmes. Aon est fière d’offrir l’égalité des chances au travail.
Nous nous engageons à offrir des possibilités d’emploi équitables et à favoriser un milieu de travail inclusif. Si vous avez besoin d’accommodements pendant le processus de candidature ou d’entrevue, veuillez nous en informer. Vous pouvez demander des accommodements en nous envoyant un courriel à ReasonableAccommodations@Aon.com ou à votre recruteur. Nous travaillerons avec vous pour répondre à vos besoins et vous garantir une expérience juste et équitable.
Aon n’accepte pas les candidatures spontanées d’entreprises de recrutement pour ce poste. Si vous êtes une entreprise de recrutement, vous ne serez en aucun cas rémunéré pour avoir proposé un candidat, même si Aon embauche ce candidat.

About the job
Operations Research Scientist
Full-Time Permanent
Downtown Toronto, ON 
Hybrid - 2~3 days per week in-office
Large Enterprise Client
Role Overview
In this position within a global decision‑science group, you’ll take open‑ended business challenges and shape them into analytical frameworks—building optimization or simulation models that guide leadership toward clearer, data‑driven choices. You’ll also be responsible for interpreting results in plain language, highlighting implications, tradeoffs, and recommended next steps.
Key Contributions
Problem Framing & Stakeholder Alignment
 Work closely with partners across the organization to understand their goals, boundaries, and measures of success. Capture any working assumptions and identify areas where information is incomplete or uncertain.
Technique Selection & Model Design
 Select modeling approaches—whether algorithmic optimizers, rule‑based heuristics, or scenario‑driven simulations—based on practical constraints and the context of the decision. Confirm model behavior using reasonableness checks and sensitivity exploration.
Model Development & Sustainment
 Build analytical tools that are robust enough for long‑term use and adaptable across multiple business areas. Collaborate with technical teams to ensure these solutions run efficiently and reliably in production environments.
Insight Delivery & Decision Support
 Convert analytical findings into clear, actionable guidance. Articulate the tradeoffs between options, advise on recommended actions, and outline how outcomes should be monitored after deployment.
Innovation & Team Leadership
 Contribute to the ongoing advancement of analytical methods within the team. Mentor peers, introduce new techniques when appropriate, and help elevate the organization’s approach to complex decision challenges.
Background & Skills
Educational Foundation
 Graduate‑level preparation (or equivalent practical experience) in fields such as industrial engineering, operations research, applied math, or similar analytical disciplines.
Modeling Expertise
 Solid understanding of optimization and simulation principles, with a track record of applying them to real‑world business situations. Able to articulate why a particular technique was chosen and where it has limitations.
Communication Strengths
 Proven ability to translate technical outputs into insights that make sense to audiences without a technical background.
Technical Proficiency
 Skilled in Python and familiar with optimization tools such as Gurobi, CPLEX, or comparable platforms.

About the job
Who are we?
Our mission is to scale intelligence to serve humanity. We’re training and deploying frontier models for developers and enterprises who are building AI systems to power magical experiences like content generation, semantic search, RAG, and agents. We believe that our work is instrumental to the widespread adoption of AI.
We obsess over what we build. Each one of us is responsible for contributing to increasing the capabilities of our models and the value they drive for our customers. We like to work hard and move fast to do what’s best for our customers.
Cohere is a team of researchers, engineers, designers, and more, who are passionate about their craft. Each person is one of the best in the world at what they do. We believe that a diverse range of perspectives is a requirement for building great products.
Join us on our mission and shape the future!
Why this role?
Lead product vision and strategy for Cohere’s North AI platform, and related products.
Shape the future of the product and company culture while working with a talented multidisciplinary team.
About Cohere
Cohere is a company at the forefront of AI and NLP technology. Cohere builds foundational models and AI solutions that help teams turn everyday effort into extraordinary impact.
About North
North is Cohere’s cutting-edge AI workspace platform, designed to revolutionize the way enterprises utilize AI. It offers a secure and customizable environment, allowing companies to deploy AI while maintaining control over sensitive data. North integrates seamlessly with existing workflows, providing a trusted platform that connects AI agents with workplace tools and applications.
Responsibilities
Customer Engagement and Research
Collaborate with enterprise customers and developers to understand their needs and pain points through various methods (feedback, focus groups, interviews, conferences).
Research industry trends, competitive landscape, and stay updated on the latest AI/ML research (e.g., NeurIPS, ICLR) to drive innovation.
Analyze product data to identify usage patterns and opportunities for improvement.
Align with leadership to ensure product strategy supports company goals.
Product Strategy and Development
Translate customer insights into a prioritized product roadmap.
Design and specify features, including defining success metrics.
Propose and prioritize new initiatives, balancing short-term and long-term investments.
Work with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and execution.
Execution and Delivery
Navigate trade-offs and challenges during the development process.
Lead project planning, resource allocation, and stakeholder communication.
Ensure product launches are data-driven, with clear metrics and hypotheses.
Share successes and learnings internally and externally.
Leadership and Impact
Embrace a hands-on, startup mindset to drive results in a fast-paced environment.
Foster a culture of learning, collaboration, and innovation.
Mentor and develop product management talent within the team.
Qualifications
Experience: 8+ years in product management, with a proven track record of leading successful products and teams.
Technical Background: Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; advanced degrees (MBA, MS, PhD) preferred.
Domain Expertise: Experience with AI/ML, developer-facing products (e.g., APIs), or large-scale systems.
Leadership Skills: Ability to inspire and lead cross-functional teams, drive strategic initiatives, and influence stakeholders.
Mindset: Scrappy, startup mentality with a passion for innovation and problem-solving.
Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly.
Preferred Qualifications
Background in engineering, machine learning, algorithms, or statistics.
Experience in a high-growth startup or tech company.
Familiarity with agile development methodologies.
Experience managing a team of Product Managers.
What We Offer
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge AI/NLP technology.
Remote-first culture with flexible working arrangements.
Competitive compensation and benefits package.
Collaborative and inclusive team environment focused on growth and impact.
If some of the above doesn’t line up perfectly with your experience, we still encourage you to apply!
We value and celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive work environment for all. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to providing equal opportunities. Should you require any accommodations during the recruitment process, please submit an Accommodations Request Form, and we will work together to meet your needs.
Full-Time Employees At Cohere Enjoy These Perks
🤝 An open and inclusive culture and work environment
🧑‍💻 Work closely with a team on the cutting edge of AI research
