About the job
Cresta is on a mission to turn every customer conversation into a competitive advantage by unlocking the true potential of the contact center. Our platform combines the best of AI and human intelligence to help contact centers discover customer insights and behavioral best practices, automate conversations and inefficient processes, and empower every team member to work smarter and faster. Born from the prestigious Stanford AI lab, Cresta's co-founder and chairman is Sebastian Thrun, the genius behind Google X, Waymo, Udacity, and more. Our leadership also includes CEO, Ping Wu, the co-founder of Google Contact Center AI and Vertex AI platform, and co-founder, Tim Shi, an early member of Open AI.
Join us on this thrilling journey to revolutionize the workforce with AI. The future of work is here, and it's at Cresta.
About The Role
At Cresta, the AI Agent team is on a mission to create state-of-the-art AI Agents that solve practical problems for our customers. We are focused on leveraging the latest technologies in Large Language Models (LLMs) and AI Agent systems, while ensuring that the solutions we develop are cost-effective, secure, and reliable. This role will involve hands-on work on cutting-edge projects, requiring innovative and passionate software engineers who can bring research into practical, scalable applications.
As a Senior Software Engineer, your goal will be to ensure that our AI Agents are backed by the most reliable and scalable server solutions. This includes designing and maintaining the server architecture that handles real-world, high-volume interactions and ensures high availability and performance. While we’re focused on server optimization and data management rather than pure research, you’ll be working with some of the most advanced technologies in the cloud and server space.
This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of AI at Cresta by solving complex problems and bringing breakthrough AI advancements into production environments.
Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain scalable and robust backend architectures for Cresta’s AI Agent solutions and proprietary models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including frontend engineers, machine learning engineers to ensure seamless integration of AI Agents into Cresta’s customer solutions.
Lead initiatives to enhance system scalability and reliability in production environments, focusing on backend services that support AI functionalities.
Drive efforts to optimize server response times, process large volumes of data efficiently, and maintain high system availability.
Innovate and implement security measures, cost-reduction strategies, and performance improvements in backend systems supporting AI Agents.
Qualifications We Value
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
5+ years of experience in backend system architecture, cloud services, or related technology fields.
Proficient in designing and maintaining clear and robust APIs with a strong understanding of protocols including gRPC, REST.
Previous experience working with Virtual Agent or AI Agent systems.
Experience in high-performance database schema design and query optimization, including knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases.
Experience in containerized application deployment using Kubernetes and Docker in microservices architectures.
Experience with cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, with a strong understanding of cloud security and compliance standards.
Perks & Benefits
We offer Cresta employees a variety of medical, dental, and vision plans, designed to fit you and your family’s needs
Paid parental leave to support you and your family
Monthly Health & Wellness allowance
Work from home office stipend to help you succeed in a remote environment
Lunch reimbursement for in-office employees 
PTO: 3 weeks in Canada 
Compensation for this position includes a base salary, equity, and a variety of benefits. Actual base salaries will be based on candidate-specific factors, including experience, skillset, and location, and local minimum pay requirements as applicable. We are actively hiring for this role in the US and Canada. Your recruiter can provide further details.

Job Title: Data Risk Analytics and Automation Officer
Job Description:
About the job
JOB DESCRIPTION
Insight Global is looking for a detail-oriented and driven Risk Analytics & Automation Consultant to join a top bank in downtown Toronto, who can immediately add value to their Digital Transformation, Data, Analytics, & AI team. BMO is undergoing a major overhaul of their enterprise risk program, including an enhanced risk framework, new policy/standards/procedures hierarchy, and improved first-line operating models. This individual needs hands-on experience developing and analyzing Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) and Key Risk Metrics (KRMs), risk data and data governance, reporting automation, and PowerApps/Power BI development. The role is ideal for a subject matter expert within data governance, automation, and developing KRIs/KRMs who can hit the ground running and provide actionable, data-driven recommendations.
Key Responsibilities (Day-to-Day)
• Review a set of 7 KRIs and core risk data, performing analysis and providing clear recommendations on effectiveness.
• Conduct quarter-over-quarter trend analysis, identify boundaries/thresholds, and assess metric performance.
• Develop enhancements to the risk appetite statement and key risk taxonomy.
• Automate intake forms, data entry processes, and reporting dashboards using PowerApps and Power BI.
• Prepare documentation related to policy, standards, and procedures as part of the broader risk framework overhaul.
• Provide insights grounded in strong data analytics; focused on data governance metrics (e.g., critical data elements count, data stewardship %, data quality rules).
• Support improvement of first-line operating models and overall risk program modernization.
• Present findings and recommendations to managers and stakeholders.
• Lead the establishment (Charter, meetings, etc.) for the Data Risk Committee.
• Facilitate discussions and follow a structured approach to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate, and manage requirements with stakeholders.
• Act as a subject matter expert on relevant regulations and policies for internal and external stakeholders.
• Identify emerging issues and trends to inform data-drive decision making.
• Break down strategic problem
REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
• Strong risk analytics experience in financial services, ideally 5+ years of experience in data analytics with previous exposure to data governance and automation.
• Hands-on experience with Power BI and PowerApps automation.
• Experience developing, assessing, and recommending improvements for Key Risk Metrics (KRMs) and Key Risk Indicators (KRIs).
• Background in statistics, analytics, or quantitative methods.
• Demonstrated ability to automate and streamline processes in past projects.
• Computer Science, Finance, Data Analytics, or related university degree.
• Strong documentation and presentation skills; able to communicate findings effectively.
• Ability to validate experience through deep-dive conversation—must have actually done the work hands-on.
Soft Skills Required:
• Strong communication skills and the ability to work with cross-functional partners.
• Analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking abilities
• Willingness to learn and curiosity.
• Detail-oriented.
• Organized and have the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and deadlines.
• Solid time management skills.
• Curiosity and creative thinker.
• Proven ability to drive results.
NICE TO HAVE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
• Familiarity with DCAMs (Data Capability Assessment Model).

At TTEC Digital, we coach clients to ensure their employees feel valued, and fully supported, because an amazing customer experience is an employee first process. Our vision is the same, a place where employees know they can thrive.
As an Azure Principal Software Engineer, you will be focused on client engagement, project leadership, and technical solution design of Azure solutions for our valued clients.
What You'll Be Doing

Work as a trusted advisor in an atmosphere of partnership with clients at the sponsor level
Consultatively leads technical and non-technical executive- or sponsor-level client stakeholders on complex technical concepts or design implications
Lead large-scale, complex technical requirements elicitation, design, and scoping discussions, internally and/or with existing and potential clients
Decompose large-scale requirements/user stories into tasks, and accurately estimates the effort for themselves or others to complete those tasks

What You'll Bring To The Role

A proven, repeatable track record of successful large-scale project delivery
Desire to constantly learn and adapt to changing technology

About the job
About AppLovin
AppLovin makes technologies that help businesses of every size connect to their ideal customers. The company provides end-to-end software and AI solutions for businesses to reach, monetize and grow their global audiences. For more information about AppLovin, visit: www.applovin.com.
To deliver on this mission, our global team is composed of team members with life experiences, backgrounds, and perspectives that mirror our developers and customers around the world. At AppLovin, we are intentional about the team and culture we are building, seeking candidates who are outstanding in their own right and also demonstrate their support of others.
Fortune recognizes AppLovin as one of the Best Workplaces in the Bay Area, and the company has been a Certified Great Place to Work for the last four years (2021-2024). Check out the rest of our awards HERE.
About AppLovin’s ECommerce Team
AppLovin is the market leader in performance advertising for mobile games. In 2024, we expanded into the ecommerce space, enabling brands to reach 150M+ U.S. daily active users in a variety of mobile games—scale that rivals the largest social platforms. In Q4, we reached a $1 billion annual run rate in gross advertiser spend in the ecommerce category alone.
AppLovin's global team is composed of team members with life experiences, backgrounds, and perspectives that mirror our customers around the world. We are intentional about the team and culture we are building, seeking candidates who are outstanding in their own right and also demonstrate their support of others.
PLEASE NOTE THIS OPPORTUNITY IS LOCATED IN OUR TORONTO OFFICE AND REQUIRES IN PERSON PRESENCE.
About The Role
AppLovin is seeking a highly quantitative Product & Strategy Growth Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will leverage your curiosity, skills, and analytical mindset to uncover insights and opportunities that enhance our eCommerce product. Your natural problem-solving instincts and passion for discovery will help you identify potential challenges and turn them into opportunities for growth. This position requires close collaboration with various internal teams such as business development, engineering, and measurement partnerships, and also provides the opportunity to work directly with AppLovin’s leadership to help shape and implement our strategic initiatives.
Key Responsibilities
Apply curiosity and data-driven problem solving to uncover insights and execute top growth opportunities for the company.
Help define and shape the company’s business intelligence products and tools, informed by industry standards and product knowledge.
Define and analyze key metrics to achieve success for our partners.
Monitor daily performance against these key metrics to identify opportunities and anomalies.
Become a mobile & e-commerce advertising guru and expert on our suite of products.
Stay relevant on industry trends and work with the engineering team to develop and test innovative, high-impact features.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Product, R&D, Engineering, Creative, and Marketing) to identify opportunities for new features, products, and partnerships.
Partner with the client teams to drive strategic initiatives and establish “learning agendas” that help clients improve business outcomes.
Translate complex research results into clear, actionable insights for a general audience.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, engineering, or computer science).
Proficiency in SQL, Python/Pandas, and Excel and comfortable working with large data sets.
Thorough understanding of data structures.
Significant experience in data analysis in an online environment, with direct exposure to scoping and executing analytical projects end-to-end.
Demonstrated ability to analyze data, uncover insights, and communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Demonstrated experience applying statistical methodologies to real-world problems.
A natural curiosity to explore the “why” behind the data and drive innovative solutions.
Strong prioritization skills to manage competing demands and deliver results.
Flexible team player who can use drive, creativity, and initiative to move the organization forward.
Preferred Qualifications
Previous experience with and/or knowledge of the following are a plus: Airflow, web development, HTTP requests.
Demonstrated ability to apply machine learning techniques to marketing measurement challenges.
AppLovin provides a competitive total compensation package with a pay for performance rewards approach. About the job
At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader — we’re changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We’re committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts.
Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work — every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet.
Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers — and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all.
About The Team And The Role
We're seeking a dynamic leader to transform how eBay delivers customer experiences through CRM. As Senior Manager, CRM AI Transformation, you will drive the vision for the next-generation CRM platform, systems, and processes. This is a newly crafted, strategic role reporting into the Director, CRM AI Transformation, with hands-on remit across Marketing, Data Science, Analytics, and MarTech.
Unlike traditional campaign management, your focus will be crafting, building, and optimizing the future-state of our CRM platform to enable orchestrated, customer-first experiences at scale. You will own the vision and build the business requirements for marketer workflows and their related technology. This technology will automate most workflows. It will help marketers increase testing velocity and deliver customer value more effectively. You will translate the business needs into product requirements in partnership with MarTech, while working with partner teams and CRM leads to ensure key use cases are accounted for.
This role blends strategy, technical enablement, and operational rigor. You'll translate the CRM transformation roadmap into actionable strategies, solutions, and initiatives with meticulous testing in service of elevating how eBay powers trust, relevance, and dedication for every customer.
What You Will Accomplish
Translate strategic objectives into actionable plans, including prioritization of use cases, success metrics, test-and-learn programs, and feedback loops for continuous optimization.
Build a detailed 6-12 month testing agenda to implement, test, and iterate on technical solutions, employing partner teams to implement.
Collaborate with CRM leads, MarTech, and Analytics teams to define requirements crafting how marketers’ workflows will evolve: interfaces for orchestration, AI data-informed insights, content creation, performance of models and agents. 
Build positive relationships and discuss the vision, roadmap, and processes with the broader team to drive consensus, clarity, and flawless execution.
Continuously supervise and integrate industry best practices and innovations to advise and elevate eBay’s CRM roadmap, bringing in third party vendors to MarTech for consideration when relevant.
What You Will Bring
Track record of translating strategic visions into actionable roadmaps, prioritizing use cases, developing measurement frameworks, and leading test-and-learn programs.
Track record of identifying platform and tooling gaps and conducting hands-on analyses in partnership with technical stakeholders.
Track record of building partnerships across Marketing, Product, Technology, and Analytics to deliver change and alignment.
Experience leading or influencing cross-disciplinary teams, encouraging technical teams, and driving customer-centric, agile experimentation throughout the organization.
Ability to socialize technical models, processes, and operating frameworks across a matrixed organization to ensure governance and clarity.
8+ years proven experience in CRM, personalization, data science, technical marketing, or related digital transformation roles.

About the job
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.
Job Description:
About The Role
Are you a software engineering leader with a technology innovator, or a founder-level engineer in a start-up? Do you have extensive 0 to 1 product or platform experience?
We are building a startup-style innovation team within Sun Life to rapidly design, build, and scale transformative digital products—including an agentic AI platform and new client experience solutions.
As Engineering Lead, In-House Accelerator, you will be the first engineering hire and technical counterpart to the AVP, Digital & Innovation Lead. In the early phase, this role is intentionally hands-on and execution-heavy: you will write production code, make pragmatic architecture decisions, and ship working software quickly in a regulated environment.
Over time, as the accelerator proves value and grows, you will build and mentor the engineering team—hiring strong builders, setting technical standards, and shaping an engineering culture rooted in ownership, speed, and learning. This is a builder-first role with clear long-term ownership for scaling both the technology and the team.
Key Responsibilities
Hands-On Technical Leadership (Immediate Priority) 
Write production-quality code daily across backend, APIs, and AI-enabled services 
Make fast, pragmatic architecture decisions that prioritize learning and delivery while keeping future scale in mind 
Design and evolve Sun Life’s agentic AI platform, including orchestration, integration layers, APIs, and guardrails 
Evaluate and experiment with new technologies, AI models, and vendor solutions 
Team Building & Engineering Culture (As the Team Scales) 
Hire, onboard, mentor, and develop a small, high-caliber engineering team (AI, backend, full-stack) 
Lead primarily through contribution and example, not process or hierarchy 
Establish engineering practices, standards, and ways of working that enable speed without sacrificing quality 
Foster a culture of experimentation, ownership, and continuous learning 
Quality, Security & Enterprise Navigation 
Build with security, reliability, and compliance awareness appropriate for a regulated financial institution 
Understand which enterprise guardrails matter now vs. later, and navigate governance without slowing experimentation 
Partner pragmatically with InfoSec, Legal, Compliance, and Data Governance as solutions mature 
Qualifications
10+ years of hands-on engineering experience, with recent, demonstrable coding work in a 0 - 1 environment.
Experience acting as a software engineering leader or founder-level engineer on complex digital products or platforms 
Strong fluency in modern cloud architecture (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and DevOps practices (CI/CD, containers, infrastructure as code) 
Proven ability to operate in ambiguity, make trade-offs, and ship imperfect solutions quickly 
Ability to grow from individual contributor to team builder—comfortable hiring, mentoring, and raising the bar for others 
Startup or early-stage product experience is a significant asset 
Nice to have: Experience with AI/ML systems → building with LLMs, prompt engineering, or agentic architectures 
What Success Looks Like
Within the first 90 days: working software shipped, real users engaged, and clear technical and product learnings captured (even if it is ugly) 
Within 6–12 months: a reusable technical foundation supporting multiple experiments and MVPs 
A small, high-performing engineering team that can move quickly without heavy process 
Demonstrated business and client impact through adoption, outcomes, and measurable value 
What’s in it for you?
Great Place to Work® Certified for Most Trusted Executive Team in Canada – 2025, 2024 and 2023
Great Place to Work® Certified for Best Workplaces in Canada - 2025
Canada Order of Excellence for Mental Health at Work® certification from Excellence Canada. Sun Life is one of only four companies in Canada to ever receive this certification – 2024
Top Work Places® for Remote Work – Monster Canada - 2024
Great Place to Work® Certified for Best Workplaces in Canada – 2024 and 2022
Great Place to Work® Certified for Best Workplaces for Women in Canada - 2024
Flexible hybrid work model. 
Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
Work and professional development that is united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives
A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
Be part of our continuous improvement journey in developing the next greatest digital enterprise experience.
Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
 For candidates with these preferred skills, exceptions beyond the usual salary range below may be possible ***

In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. About the job
EvenUp is on a mission to close the justice gap using technology and AI. We empower personal injury lawyers and victims to get the justice they deserve. Our products enable law firms to secure faster settlements, higher payouts, and better outcomes for victims injured through no fault of their own in vehicle collisions, accidents, natural disasters, and more.
We are one of the fastest-growing vertical SaaS companies in history, and we are just getting started. EvenUp is backed by top VCs, including Bessemer Venture Partners, Bain Capital Ventures, SignalFire, and Lightspeed. We are looking to expand our team with talented, driven, and collaborative individuals who seek to have a lasting impact. Learn more at www.evenuplaw.com.
🎥 Life as an Engineer at EvenUp
Location & Work Model
This is a hybrid role, with an expectation of being in our Toronto office three days per week.
About The Team
EvenUp’s document products empower attorneys to represent their clients more effectively and secure better outcomes. With over $1.5B in damages claimed to date, the Document Generation team is developing an industry-leading, AI-native platform for generating legal documents in personal injury law.
As Engineering Manager for Document Generation, you will lead a high-impact team building the systems at the core of EvenUp’s business. You’ll balance strategic leadership with hands-on technical contribution, collaborating closely with founders, product, and cross-functional partners to scale AI-native workflows that directly advance EvenUp’s mission to ensure personal injury victims receive fair compensation.
Responsibilities
Lead and scale a team building AI-native document generation workflows
Drive execution across complex, mission-critical initiatives tied to EvenUp’s core products
Partner with Product, Design, Legal, and Operations to deliver high-quality, customer-centric solutions
Establish and uphold a high bar for engineering quality, reliability, and operational excellence
Guide technical decision-making across architecture, system design, and AI integration
Use data-driven insights to continuously improve delivery velocity, quality,
What You’ll Do
Team Leadership & Strategy: Set and communicate a clear technical and execution vision aligned with EvenUp’s broader goals. Lead engineers through the full software lifecycle, from planning and architecture to deployment and monitoring. Foster a culture of ownership, accountability, collaboration, and continuous learning
Product & AI-Native Development: Guide the development of advanced AI workflows, including LLM-based systems and expert-review pipelines. Balance innovation and pragmatism when scaling AI-driven products in production environments. Contribute hands-on as needed, particularly in complex or high-impact technical areas
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with founders, product managers, designers, and stakeholders to scope, prioritize, and deliver initiatives. Translate business and customer needs into clear technical direction for the team
Engineering Excellence & Operations: Champion best practices across architecture, coding standards, testing, security, observability, and reliability. Ensure systems handling sensitive data are secure, compliant, and production-ready. Oversee operational ownership, including incident response, on-call health, and reducing operational toil
Mentorship & Growth: Recruit, mentor, and develop engineers through regular feedback, coaching, and career development. Support performance management, growth planning, and team health
What We Look For
4+ years of direct people-management experience leading software engineering teams
Proven ability to ship and scale complex, high-quality software systems
Strong technical background with experience in distributed systems and modern backend architectures
Demonstrated success balancing strategic leadership with hands-on technical contribution
Experience leading teams in fast-paced, high-growth environments
Excellent communication skills and ability to influence across cross-functional partners
Strong sense of ownership, accountability, and bias toward execution
Bonus
Experience or strong interest in AI/ML, LLM-based systems, or legal tech
Background in AI-native or social impact–driven products

Overview:
Are you passionate about building impactful, data‑driven marketing solutions?
We are seeking a Senior Marketing Analytics Consultant to lead high‑value analytics initiatives, elevate marketing performance, and advance enterprise data maturity. In this role, you’ll shape analytics strategy, build scalable data sources, and guide cross‑functional teams with strong expertise in marketing analytics, martech, and data engineering concepts.
Responsibilities
Assess current marketing data ecosystem; identify gaps and improvement opportunities
Partner with marketing, digital, and data teams to refine requirements and guide solution design

Communicate progress, challenges, and risks to stakeholders, maintaining strong alignment across teams
Investigate and resolve issues that hinder analytics development or data pipeline progression
Stay informed about new marketing analytics, martech, and data technologies, maintaining a “trusted advisor” role
Assist in estimating effort, timelines, and resource needs for analytics initiatives
Conduct assessments of existing marketing analytics setups, identifying gaps, bottlenecks, and improvement opportunities
Qualifications, Skills & Experience
Degree in Marketing Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or related field
5–10 years in marketing analytics or similar senior analytics role
Hands-on experience with Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
Strong Tableau visualization skills
Experience with PySpark or similar data processing tools
Solid understanding of martech ecosystems, tagging, and digital measurement
Proven ability to lead strategy, roadmaps, and stakeholder engagement
Experience building datasets and partnering with data engineering teams
Strong communication skills and comfort presenting to senior audiences
Ability to operate independently in a fast-paced environment
Nice to Have
Background in Data Science or Data Engineering
Experience with experimentation frameworks, attribution modeling, or advanced statistical analysis
Familiarity with cloud analytics
Experience with marketing data ingestion or ETL processes

Job Title: Senior Product Manager, MCP & Agentic AI
Job Description:
About the job
Job Requisition ID #
25WD93731
The French translation can be found below!/La traduction en français se trouve plus bas!
Position Overview
As a Senior Product Manager on the Product & Platform Trust team, you are responsible for transforming how our internal engineering and business teams understand and improve our trust posture across security, resilience, privacy, and responsible AI. You will define product strategy and build AI‑native, agentic, and MCP-based frameworks that check, monitor, and surface how services are performing against requirements; guide owners to remediate vulnerabilities and gaps; and increasingly, to automate remediation on their behalf.
You will develop internal tools that are beloved by developers for their deep integration into engineering tools and workflows, and that can also translate complex signals into clear, explainable views for non‑technical stakeholders. Product Managers in our organization work with matrixed teams and sit at the intersection of engineering, security, compliance, design, data science, and strategy. On an average day, you might align on a multi‑year vision with senior leadership; refine an experimentation plan with AI/ML and platform engineers; review UX flows for an internal remediation assistant; analyze telemetry from thousands of services; and tell a crisp story that connects trust posture improvements to customer and regulatory outcomes.
This role focuses on technologies that provide near‑real‑time visibility, guidance, and automation for trust posture: from security vulnerabilities and privacy risks to responsible AI safeguards and service resilience. The products you build will help internal teams ship secure, compliant, and reliable capabilities faster, while giving non‑developer audiences—such as leadership, legal, and customer‑facing teams—clear insight into how we are meeting our commitments.
Responsibilities
Own the vision, strategy, and multi‑year roadmap for internal tools and frameworks that use AI, MCP, and agentic methods to assess, explain, and improve security, privacy, responsible AI, and resilience across services
Collaborate with design, data science, and engineering to craft experiences that are powerful for technical users yet understandable for non‑technical stakeholders, including AI-supported dashboards and narratives that communicate in plain language
Work closely with internal customers to discover pain points in today’s trust workflows, identify high‑value agentic and automation use cases, and validate them through rapid experimentation and iterative releases
Define clear success metrics for trust posture, remediation velocity, and user adoption; instrument products to capture those signals and use them to drive prioritization and continuous improvement
Evangelize the product vision and influence senior stakeholders by telling compelling, data‑backed stories about how automated, AI‑driven trust tooling reduces risk, improves developer experience, and strengthens customer trust
Drive innovation by identifying emerging AI, MCP, and agentic techniques and rapidly iterating on new capabilities to improve impact
Minimum Qualifications
7+ years of product management or closely related experience, including significant time working on platform, infrastructure, developer tooling, or data/AI products
Proven ability to take products from 0→1 by defining vision, building roadmaps, and delivering features
Demonstrated ability to discover, define, deliver, and iterate on complex technical products, including working closely with engineers to translate abstract requirements into concrete designs and shipped features
Experience building products for technical users (e.g., developers, SDETs, data/ML engineers) and driving adoption of internal platforms or tools at scale
Strong communication and storytelling skills, with the ability to explain complex technical and risk concepts to both deeply technical and non‑technical audiences and to build consensus across diverse stakeholders
Proven track record of using data and telemetry to prioritize work, measure impact, and refine product strategy
Ability to lead cross‑functional teams in a large, matrixed organization and to drive outcomes across distributed teams and time zones
Preferred Qualifications
Background in AI, LLMs, or agentic systems, especially products that use tools, planning, or automation to act on behalf of users in real workflows
Strong understanding of vector databases, embeddings, and context management frameworks (for example, Model Context Protocol)
Experience with natural language processing (NLP) and conversational AI
Experience designing or operating autonomous/agentic systems, including prompt routing or multi‑model orchestration frameworks
Familiarity with open‑source AI standards and interoperability frameworks that enable multi‑model or multi‑tool ecosystems
Experience in one or more Trust‑related domains such as application security, privacy engineering, compliance engineering, responsible AI, or service reliability/resilience
Familiarity with relevant regulations and frameworks (for example, SOC 2, ISO 27001, GDPR, FedRAMP, AI governance or risk frameworks) and how they translate into technical controls and evidence
Experience with machine learning, software engineering, or data infrastructure
The Ideal Candidate
You get stuff done and you simplify what is complex and ambiguous
Self-starter who steps up to handle new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm
Courageous and are not afraid to take charge
You lead in a way that demonstrates finesse, emotional intelligence, and business savvy
Able to quickly understand where bottlenecks exist, how activities and processes are interrelated to each other, and make recommendations that can be realized
Know how to influence priorities through data and storytelling
Don’t shy away from causes that may face resistance, and you know how to develop a shared vision and understand the value of getting people on board with your ideas
Love a dynamic environment with complex and critical priorities
Have a strong work ethic, craftsmanship, and quality standards for communications
Comfortable in acting with a clear sense of ownership, taking personal responsibility for decisions, actions, and failures
Gain the trust and support of others and give credit to others for accomplishments and contributions
Description Du Poste
En tant que chef de produit senior au sein de l'équipe Product & Platform Trust, vous êtes chargé de transformer la manière dont nos équipes d'ingénieurs et commerciales internes appréhendent et améliorent notre posture en matière de sécurité, de résilience, de confidentialité et d'IA responsable. Vous définirez la stratégie produit et développerez des cadres natifs IA, agentifs et basés sur MCP qui vérifient, surveillent et mettent en évidence les performances des services par rapport aux exigences ; vous guiderez les propriétaires dans la correction des vulnérabilités et des lacunes ; et, de plus en plus, vous automatiserez les corrections en leur nom.
Vous développerez des outils internes appréciés des développeurs pour leur intégration profonde dans les outils d'ingénierie et les flux de travail, et qui peuvent également traduire des signaux complexes en vues claires et explicables pour les parties prenantes non techniques. Les chefs de produit de notre organisation travaillent avec des équipes matricielles et se situent à l'intersection de l'ingénierie, de la sécurité, de la conformité, de la conception, de la science des données et de la stratégie. Au quotidien, vous pourrez être amené à vous aligner sur une vision pluriannuelle avec la direction, à affiner un plan d'expérimentation avec des ingénieurs en IA/ML et en plateformes, à examiner les flux UX pour un assistant de correction interne, à analyser la télémétrie de milliers de services et à présenter un récit clair qui relie les améliorations de la posture de confiance aux résultats pour les clients et en matière de réglementation.
Ce poste est axé sur les technologies qui offrent une visibilité, des conseils et une automatisation en temps quasi réel pour la posture de confiance : des vulnérabilités de sécurité et des risques liés à la confidentialité aux mesures de protection responsables en matière d'IA et à la résilience des services. Les produits que vous développerez aideront les équipes internes à fournir plus rapidement des fonctionnalités sécurisées, conformes et fiables, tout en donnant aux publics non développeurs, tels que les équipes de direction, juridiques et en contact avec la clientèle, un aperçu clair de la manière dont nous respectons nos engagements.
Responsabilités
Définir la vision, la stratégie et la feuille de route pluriannuelle pour les outils et les cadres internes qui utilisent l'IA, le MCP et des méthodes agissantes pour évaluer, expliquer et améliorer la sécurité, la confidentialité, l'IA responsable et la résilience dans tous les services
Collaborer avec les équipes de conception, de science des données et d'ingénierie afin de créer des expériences puissantes pour les utilisateurs techniques, mais compréhensibles pour les parties prenantes non techniques, notamment des tableaux de bord et des récits soutenus par l'IA qui communiquent dans un langage simple
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les clients internes afin de découvrir les points faibles des workflows de confiance actuels, d'identifier les cas d'utilisation de l'agentique et de l'automatisation à forte valeur ajoutée, et de les valider par le biais d'expérimentations rapides et de versions itératives
Définir des indicateurs de réussite clairs pour la posture de confiance, la vitesse de remédiation et l'adoption par les utilisateurs ; mettre en place des produits pour capter ces signaux et les utiliser pour déterminer les priorités et améliorer en permanence
Promouvoir la vision du produit et influencer les parties prenantes de haut niveau en racontant des histoires convaincantes, étayées par des données, sur la manière dont les outils de confiance automatisés et basés sur l'IA réduisent les risques, améliorent l'expérience des développeurs et renforcent la confiance des clients
Stimuler l'innovation en identifiant les techniques émergentes en matière d'IA, de MCP et d'agents, et en itérant rapidement sur de nouvelles capacités afin d'améliorer l'impact
Qualifications Minimales
Plus de 7 ans d'expérience en gestion de produits ou dans un domaine étroitement lié, y compris une expérience significative dans le domaine des plateformes, des infrastructures, des outils de développement ou des produits liés aux données/à l'IA
Capacité avérée à faire passer des produits de 0 à 1 en définissant une vision, en élaborant des feuilles de route et en fournissant des fonctionnalités
Capacité avérée à découvrir, définir, fournir et itérer des produits techniques complexes, y compris en travaillant en étroite collaboration avec des ingénieurs pour traduire des exigences abstraites en conceptions concrètes et en fonctionnalités livrées
Expérience dans la création de produits destinés à des utilisateurs techniques (par exemple, développeurs, SDET, ingénieurs de données/ML) et dans la promotion de l'adoption à grande échelle de plateformes ou d'outils internes
Solides compétences en communication et en narration, avec la capacité d'expliquer des concepts techniques et des risques complexes à des publics à la fois très techniques et non techniques, et de parvenir à un consensus entre les différentes parties prenantes
Expérience avérée dans l'utilisation des données et de la télémétrie pour hiérarchiser les tâches, mesurer l'impact et affiner la stratégie produit
Capacité à diriger des équipes interfonctionnelles au sein d'une grande organisation matricielle et à obtenir des résultats auprès d'équipes dispersées et de fuseaux horaires différents
Qualifications Souhaitées
Expérience dans le domaine de l'IA, des LLM ou des systèmes agentifs, en particulier les produits qui utilisent des outils, la planification ou l'automatisation pour agir au nom des utilisateurs dans des flux de travail réels
Excellente compréhension des bases de données vectorielles, des intégrations et des cadres de gestion du contexte (par exemple, le protocole Model Context Protocol)
Expérience dans le traitement du langage naturel (NLP) et l'IA conversationnelle
Expérience dans la conception ou l'exploitation de systèmes autonomes/agents, y compris les cadres de routage rapide ou d'orchestration multimodèle
Connaissance des normes d'IA open source et des cadres d'interopérabilité qui permettent des écosystèmes multimodèles ou multi-outils
Expérience dans un ou plusieurs domaines liés à la confiance, tels que la sécurité des applications, l'ingénierie de la confidentialité, l'ingénierie de la conformité, l'IA responsable ou la fiabilité/résilience des services
Connaissance des réglementations et des cadres pertinents (par exemple, SOC 2, ISO 27001, RGPD, FedRAMP, gouvernance de l'IA ou cadres de risque) et de la manière dont ils se traduisent en contrôles techniques et en preuves
Expérience en apprentissage automatique, en génie logiciel ou en infrastructure de données
Le candidat idéal
Vous accomplissez des tâches et simplifiez ce qui est complexe et ambigu
Vous êtes proactif et vous vous mobilisez pour saisir de nouvelles opportunités et relever des défis difficiles avec un sens de l'urgence, une grande énergie et un enthousiasme certain
Vous êtes courageux et n'hésitez pas à prendre les choses en main
Vous dirigez avec finesse, intelligence émotionnelle et sens des affaires
Vous êtes capable de comprendre rapidement où se situent les goulots d'étranglement, comment les activités et les processus sont interdépendants, et de formuler des recommandations réalisables
Vous savez influencer les priorités grâce aux données et à la narration
Vous n'hésitez pas à vous attaquer à des causes qui peuvent rencontrer une certaine résistance, et vous savez comment développer une vision commune et comprenez l'importance de rallier les gens à vos idées
Vous appréciez les environnements dynamiques avec des priorités complexes et critiques
Vous avez une solide éthique de travail, un grand sens de l'artisanat et des normes de qualité élevées en matière de communication
Vous êtes à l'aise pour agir avec un sens clair des responsabilités, en assumant personnellement les décisions, les actions et les échecs
Vous gagnez la confiance et le soutien des autres et vous leur accordez le mérite de leurs réalisations et de leurs contributions

Job Title: Analytics Lead, Product Insights - Rider Experience
Job Description:
About the job
At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. We aim to achieve this by cultivating a work environment where all team members belong and have the opportunity to thrive.
Data and analytics are at the heart of Lyft’s products and decision-making. The Rider organization is focused on building a seamless, best-in-class rideshare experience for riders. As a Data Analyst on the Rider Experience team, you’ll partner directly with cross-functional stakeholders to identify opportunities and design solutions for improving Rider’s experience. You’ll leverage your analytical expertise to deliver actionable insights and recommendations to drive quality business decisions with customer-facing impact.
The ideal candidate is obsessed with improving customer experience with data insights, a critical thinker and exceptional problem solver who can identify business opportunities and drive impact and cross-functional alignment, shaping product and business strategy through data-centric presentations.
Responsibilities
Manages and owns the end-to-end analysis on rider experience, including creating frameworks, defining key metrics, develop dashboards and monitoring business health to drive decision-making and prioritization based on Lyft's business, strategy, and mission
Work closely with cross-functional partners (e.g. Engineering, Product, Marketing) to deliver actionable data-driven insights and identify opportunities for continuously improving the rider experience 
Monitor and diagnose rideshare offerings product performance and present findings to senior leadership 
Creates and monitors product performance dashboards and communicates findings to cross-functional team
Act as a subject matter expert and thought partner in focused product area
Breaks down complex problems from end to end and leads execution towards business impact with clear goals. 
Design A/B testing and execute analyses to evaluate the impact of new product feature improvements
Experience:
Degree in a quantitative field (e.g. statistics, applied math, economics, engineering).
4+ years of relevant work experience.
Experience in leading data-driven projects from definition to execution. 
Proficiency in SQL and Python. 
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to transition between data and business problems.
Exceptional communication (listening, written, and oral) skills with the ability to present findings & recommendations targeted to the audience in question.
Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and trust across functions and work collaboratively.
Experience in online experimentation and statistical analysis.
Passion for driving business impact with data.
Preferred:
Advanced degrees in quantitative fields.
Experience with two-sided market problems.
Experience in driving product growth with data insights, including understanding user behaviors, long-term user value, and product lifecycle. 
Benefits:
Extended health and dental coverage options, along with life insurance and disability benefits
Mental health benefits
Family building benefits
Child care and pet benefits
Access to a Lyft funded Health Care Savings Account
RRSP plan to help save for your future
In addition to provincial observed holidays, salaried team members are covered under Lyft's flexible paid time off policy. The policy allows team members to take off as much time as they need (with manager approval). Hourly team members get 15 days paid time off, with an additional day for each year of service 
Lyft is proud to support new parents with 18 weeks of paid time off, designed as a top-up plan to complement provincial programs. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible.
Subsidized commuter benefits
Lyft is committed to creating an inclusive workforce that fosters belonging. Lyft believes that every person has a right to equal employment opportunities without discrimination because of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, pardoned record of offences, or any other basis protected by applicable law or by Company policy. Lyft also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Accommodation for persons with disabilities will be provided upon request in accordance with applicable law during the application and hiring process. Please contact your recruiter if you wish to make such a request.
Lyft highly values having employees working in-office to foster a collaborative work environment and company culture. This role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule — Team Members will be expected to work in the office at least 3 days per week, including on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Lyft considers working in the office at least 3 days per week to be an essential function of this hybrid role. Your recruiter can share more information about the various in-office perks Lyft offers. Additionally, hybrid roles have the flexibility to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per year. #Hybrid
The expected base pay range for this position in the Toronto area is CAD $102,000 - CAD $127,500, not inclusive of potential equity offering, bonus or benefits. Salary ranges are dependent on a variety of factors, including qualifications, experience and geographic location. Your recruiter can share more information about the salary range specific to your working location and other factors during the hiring process.
Lyft may use artificial intelligence to screen applicants, however, Lyft employees make the ultimate selection and hiring decisions.
This job fills an existing vacancy.

About the job
Company Description
Mars United℠ Commerce is a global commerce marketing practice that aligns people, technology, and intelligence to make the business of our clients better today than it was yesterday. Our worldwide capabilities coalesce into four key disciplines — Strategy & Analytics, Content & Experiences, Digital Commerce, and Retail Consultancy — that individually deliver unmatched results for clients and collectively give them an unparalleled network of seamlessly integrated functions across the entire commerce marketing ecosystem. These disciplines are powered by our industry-leading technology platform, Marilyn®, which helps marketers understand the total business impact of their commerce marketing activation, enabling them to make better decisions, create connected experiences, and drive stronger, measurable results. Learn more at https://www.marsunited.com/.
Overview
The Director, Analytics will lead a team of analysts and manage analytics projects to ensure the delivery of high-quality insights that support and advance business objectives. This role requires strategic vision, strong leadership, and deep expertise in data analytics and reporting and reporting methodologies.
Primary Responsibilities
Uphold and implement the strategic vision for the Analytics function.
Collaborate with cross-functional leaders to identify areas of opportunity for Analytics growth within clients and new business prospects. 
Lead and manage a group of Analysts, providing mentorship, guidance, and professional development opportunities.
Support department leadership with annual 1YP. 
Support and sign off on the recruitment of less experienced team members. 
Collaborate with senior stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into actionable analytics projects.
Provide hands-on oversight and support for critical, time-sensitive analytics deliverables, including performance deep dives, KPI investigations, and executive or client-requested analyses.
Oversee the execution of data analysis projects, ensuring timely and accurate delivery of insights.
Oversee, develop and optimize data models by processing, analyzing, and extracting data from various internal and external media sources.
Lead and support annual planning initiatives with clients.
Ensure the accuracy and quality of all data, reports, and visualizations through rigorous QA processes.
Maintain a collaborative approach to teamwork and problem-solving.
Exhibit a dynamic personality to effectively engage and influence senior stakeholders.
Show a passion for challenging business conventions, always thinking of ways to improve and grow.
Provide sound decision-making skills based on industry knowledge.
Design and implement robust evaluation metrics and frameworks to assess and monitor media performance.
Deliver best-in-class campaign reporting and insights, enabling data-driven decisions for media mix investing within the retail media ecosystem.
Synthesize performance and learning across retailers, tactics, and partners to develop cross-retailer points of view, implications, and optimization recommendations.
Audit advertising campaigns, troubleshoot performance issues, and track and report on performance and KPIs.
Provide consultation and advise Commerce Media planning and buying teams on retail media campaign performance, plan optimizations, and recommendations.
Partner with the Commerce Media team to discuss advertising performance, campaign insights, and recommended optimizations with clients.
Support the development of data-backed retail data clean room reporting for the agency’s retail media practice.
Lead and oversee data collection and analysis for retail media DSP and search campaigns to drive clients’ business goals.
Develop and lead high-stakes client presentations.
Communicate findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders.
Ensure compliance with data governance and security policies.
Continuously improve retail media analytics product and service offerings.
Maintain relevant marketing certifications and stay informed of marketing trends and tools.
Lead and assist in knowledge sharing through internal communication events, training, and other written materials.
Monitor industry standards, guidelines, and best practices, including IAB and retailer measurement updates, and translate them into applied analytics frameworks and client recommendations.
Attract, retain, and develop top analytics engineering talent, ensuring the team maintains a diversity of skills, backgrounds, and experience.
Lead the recruitment of less experienced team members. 
Support wider agency initiatives.
Support the creation of white papers, agency "points of view" blog posts, etc. on data engineering topics.
Support new business RFP and pitching efforts, as required.
Foster a culture of continuous learning and innovation within the Analytics team.
Show accountability, take responsibility, and demonstrate resilience.
Show up - be accountable, take responsibility, and help others get back up when they are down. 
Make stuff.
Share so others can see what’s happening.
Skillsets Required
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 10-15 years of experience in data analysis and analytics management.
Strong leadership capabilities to manage and mentor the analytics team, to recruit and retain talent.
Excellent project management skills to handle multiple high-priority projects and meet deadlines.
Superior communication skills to convey complex data insights to non-technical and senior stakeholders. 
Be a confident presenter and clear, persuasive communicator (verbal and written).
Strategic thinking to develop and implement effective analytics strategies.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data querying and manipulation.
Demonstrable track record of innovating in the analytics field. 
Expertise in data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI.
Strong statistical analysis skills to derive actionable insights from data.
Proficient in data modeling to structure and organize data effectively.
Excellent story-telling capabilities. 
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and big data technologies.
Strong experience with data governance and security protocols.
Demonstrated success in leading marketing analytics methodologies like Multi-Touch Attribution (MTA), Audience Development, Clustering, Markov Chain analysis, etc.
Experience with retail media platforms such as Amazon, Walmart, Target, Kroger, Criteo, Citrus, and third-party API partners (SKAI, Pacvue, etc).
Strong technical understanding of a range of marketing concepts such as first-party and third-party cookie-based data collection, developing and activating audience segments from digital analytics and data management platforms.
Experience in reporting and analytics within the retail/shopper marketing domain, interfacing with senior/executive stakeholders.
Familiarity with and experience in adhering to data governance and security protocols.
Proven track record of driving business results through data-driven decision-making.
Experience and positive track record in mentoring and developing junior team members.
Collaborative mindset to work seamlessly with creative, strategic, and client-facing teams.
Critical thinking to analyze data and derive meaningful marketing insights.
Additional Information
Our Publicis Groupe motto “Viva La Différence” means we’re better together, and we believe that our differences make us stronger. It means we honor and celebrate all identities, across all facets of intersectionality, and it underpins all that we do as an organization. We are focused on fostering belonging and creating equitable & inclusive experiences for all talent.
Publicis Groupe provides robust and inclusive benefit programs and policies to support the evolving and diverse needs of our talent and enable every person to grow and thrive. Our benefits package includes medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401K, as well as parental and family care leave, family forming assistance, tuition reimbursement, and flexible time off.
We also offer medical and voluntary benefits to our freelancers and temporary employees. Voluntary benefit options include supplemental medical insurance, transportation, and parking benefits, legal benefits, pet insurance, and auto and home insurance.
You must be actively employed for 90 consecutive calendar days in order to be eligible for Publicis medical and voluntary benefits. You will also be eligible to participate in the Publicis 401(k) Plan after you complete 1,000 work hours in a consecutive 12-month period.
If you require accommodation or assistance with the application or onboarding process specifically, please contact USMSTACompliance@publicis.com.
Compensation Range: $130,000- $150,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. Job Description:
About the job
At PwC, our people in business application consulting specialise in consulting services for a variety of business applications, helping clients optimise operational efficiency. These individuals analyse client needs, implement software solutions, and provide training and support for seamless integration and utilisation of business applications, enabling clients to achieve their strategic objectives.
Meaningful work you’ll be part of 
PwC's Salesforce practice is seeking a technical leader who thrives in the code. This is a hands-on role will focus on architecting solutions, writing and reviewing code, and solving complex technical challenges—while mentoring developers and shaping technical strategy for the practice. You'll lead our next-generation AI initiatives, working directly with Agentforce, Data Cloud, and the Lightning Platform to build transformative solutions for enterprise clients. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
What You'll Build
AI agents and automation using Agentforce, Apex, Flows, and Einstein GPT—integrating large language models with Salesforce data
High-performance architectures processing millions of records using Data Cloud, batch Apex, platform events, and asynchronous patterns
Complex integrations with REST/SOAP APIs, MuleSoft, external systems, and real-time event-driven architectures
Lightning Web Components and Aura components for sophisticated user experiences with custom JavaScript frameworks
Technical Environment & Tools
Apex
 Lightning Web Components (LWC)
 Aura
 Visualforce
 SOQL/SOSL
 Platform Events
 Agentforce
 Einstein GPT
 Prompt Builder
 Data Cloud
 REST/SOAP APIs
 JavaScript (ES6+)
 Git/GitHub
 Salesforce CLI
 VS Code
 DevOps/CI-CD
 Postman
 JIRA
 Confluence
Your Technical Leadership Role
Lead technical delivery teams of 5-10 developers on complex Salesforce implementations and architect end-to-end solutions—from data model design to integration patterns to AI agent workflows
Conduct hands-on code reviews, pair programming sessions, technical design workshops and make critical technical decisions on platform limits, scalability, performance optimization, and AI model selection
Translate client business requirements into technical specifications and development user stories
Mentor developers on advanced Apex patterns, LWC best practices, and AI implementation strategies
Establish coding standards, testing frameworks (unit tests with >75% coverage), and deployment best practices
CI/CD pipelines and DevOps processes using Salesforce CLI, Git, and deployment automation tools (e.g., Copado, Gearset)
Custom CPQ solutions, OmniStudio interfaces, and Industry Cloud implementations
Experiences And Skills You’ll Use To Solve
5+ years hands-on Salesforce development with 3+ years in technical lead roles—you must be able to code in Apex and LWC proficiently
Deep expertise in object-oriented programming, design patterns (Factory, Strategy, Singleton), and governor limit management
Proven experience architecting and implementing complex integrations (REST/SOAP, middleware, event-driven systems)
Strong understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, large data volumes (LDV), and performance optimization strategies
Experience with Agile/Scrum delivery and full SDLC—user stories, sprint planning, retrospectives, CI/CD automation
One or more Salesforce Developer certifications: Platform Developer I & II, Application Architect, System Architect, or Technical Architect
Familiarity with modern development practices: version control (Git), automated testing, code quality tools, pull request workflows
Experience with: AI/ML model integration
 Python or Java
 SQL/database design
 AWS/Azure cloud platforms
 Omnistudio (FlexCards, DataRaptors)
 Industries CPQ
 Mulesoft APIs
 Platform Events and Change Data Capture
 Heroku
 Marketing Cloud or Pardot
 Einstein Analytics/CRM Analytics
PwC Canada is committed to cultivating an inclusive, hybrid work environment. Exact expectations for your team can be discussed with your interviewer
This position ensures continuity and upholds our standards of excellence following the departure of a valued team member.

Given our national recruiting approach, ranges may vary for positions in other locations. At PwC Canada, base salary is determined by your skills, experience, qualifications and work location. In addition to base salary, eligible employees may have opportunities to participate in variable incentive pay programs which are designed to reward individual and firm-wide achievements. We are committed to offering competitive compensation and adhere to all relevant pay transparency legislation. During the hiring process, our Talent Acquisition team will provide details about our comprehensive total rewards package.
Why you’ll love PwC 
We’re inspiring and empowering our people to change the world. Powered by the latest technology, you’ll be a part of diverse teams helping public and private clients build trust and deliver sustained outcomes. This meaningful work, and our continuous development environment, will take your career to the next level. We reward your impact, and support your wellbeing, through a competitive compensation package, inclusive benefits and flexibility programs that will help you thrive in work and life. Description Du Poste
CLIENT
Développer et promouvoir des modèles de données à l'aide d'outils de modélisation standard de l'industrie
Évaluer les besoins d'affaires en recherchant, analysant et documentant les besoins en données d'affaires

Soulever et gérer les demandes de changement en collaboration avec les parties prenantes de l'entreprise, en soutenant les processus de gestion des versions et en assurant une livraison rapide.

Assurez-vous que les métadonnées d'entreprise et la lignée des données sont bien documentées et intégrées aux outils de gestion des métadonnées d'entreprise, facilitant ainsi une meilleure compréhension des affaires.
Respectez les meilleures pratiques en matière de sécurité des données, en veillant à ce que les aspects techniques et commerciaux soient protégés contre les vulnérabilités courantes.
Documentez les exigences d'affaires et les décisions techniques, en veillant à ce que les risques, les leçons apprises et les occasions d'amélioration soient communiqués entre les équipes.
Aider à protéger les intérêts de l'organisation en identifiant les risques d'affaires, tout en assurant le respect des politiques internes et des lignes directrices réglementaires.
Restez à jour sur les tendances de l'industrie, la connaissance croissante des processus d'affaires, des outils de données et des meilleures pratiques pour améliorer la collaboration entre les équipes d'affaires et technologiques.
Respecter les politiques/procédures internes ainsi que les directives réglementaires applicables
EMPLOYÉ / ÉQUIPE

Capable de travailler avec un minimum d'orientation sur plusieurs projets et priorités

EXPÉRIENCE ET/OU FORMATION
Diplôme de premier cycle ou certificat technique et/ou
2+ ans d'expérience pertinente issue d'un parcours en administration des affaires, statistiques, mathématiques, scientifiques ou financières
2+ ans d'expérience en ingénierie des données, avec un fort accent sur les technologies de mégadonnées, de préférence Azure.
Solides compétences en SQL pour l'interrogation, la transformation et l'analyse de données, incluant les jointures, les agrégations et les considérations de performance.
Expérience pratique de l'écosystème Azure; Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Data Factory, Synapse et d'autres services connexes.
Compétent en Python et PySpark.
Mentalité analytique, pensée critique et résolution de problèmes. Capable de résoudre des problèmes complexes nécessitant l'analyse de plusieurs couches de sources en amont et en aval.

À propos de nous
La TD est un chef de file mondial dans le secteur des institutions financières. Elle représente la cinquième banque en Amérique du Nord de par son nombre de succursales. Chaque jour, nous offrons une expérience client légendaire à plus de 27 millions de ménages et d’entreprises au Canada, aux États-Unis et partout dans le monde. Plus de 95 000 collègues de la TD mettent en commun leurs compétences, leur talent et leur créativité au service de la Banque, des clients qu’elle sert et des économies qu’elle appuie. Nous sommes guidés par notre vision d’être une meilleure banque et par notre objectif d’enrichir la vie de nos clients, de nos collectivités et de nos collègues.
La TD est une entreprise profondément engagée à être une leader en matière d’expérience client. Voilà pourquoi nous croyons que chaque collègue, peu importe son secteur d’activité, est en contact avec la clientèle. En parallèle de l’évolution de nos activités et de notre stratégie, nous innovons afin d’améliorer l’expérience client et de créer des capacités pour façonner l’avenir des services bancaires. Que vous ayez plusieurs années d’expérience dans le secteur bancaire ou que vous commenciez tout juste votre carrière dans le domaine des services financiers, nous pouvons vous aider à réaliser votre plein potentiel. Vous pourrez compter sur nos programmes de formation et de mentorat et sur des conversations sur le perfectionnement et le leadership pour réaliser votre plein potentiel et atteindre vos objectifs. Notre croissance en tant qu’entreprise rime avec la vôtre.
Notre programme de rémunération globale
Notre programme de rémunération globale reflète les investissements que nous faisons pour aider nos collègues et leur famille à atteindre leurs objectifs en matière de bien-être mental, physique et financier. La rémunération globale à la TD inclut le salaire de base, la rémunération variable et bien d’autres régimes clés, comme des avantages sociaux en matière de santé et de bien-être, des régimes d’épargne et de retraite, des congés payés, des avantages bancaires et des rabais, des occasions de développement de carrière et des programmes de récompenses et reconnaissance. En savoir plus
Renseignements Supplémentaires
Nous sommes ravis que vous envisagiez une carrière à la TD. Sachez que nous avons à cœur d’aider nos collègues à réussir dans leur vie tant personnelle que professionnelle. C’est d’ailleurs pourquoi nous leur offrons des conversations sur le perfectionnement, des programmes de formation et un régime d’avantages sociaux concurrentiel.
Perfectionnement des collègues 
Un cheminement professionnel particulier vous intéresse ou vous cherchez à acquérir certaines compétences? Nous tenons à vous mettre sur la voie de la réussite. Vous aurez des conversations régulières sur le développement de carrière, le perfectionnement et le rendement avec votre gestionnaire. Une variété de programmes de mentorat et une plateforme d’apprentissage en ligne seront également à votre disposition pour vous aider à ouvrir de nouvelles portes. Que vous ayez à cœur d’aider les clients et souhaitiez élargir votre expérience ou que vous préfériez coacher et inspirer vos collègues, sachez que la TD propose un grand nombre de cheminements professionnels et qu’elle s’engage à vous aider à relever les occasions qui vont dans le sens de vos objectifs.
Formation et intégration
Nous tenons à nous assurer que vous disposez des outils et ressources nécessaires pour réussir à votre nouveau poste. Dans cette optique, nous organiserons des séances d’intégration et de formation.
Processus d’entrevue 
Nous communiquerons avec les candidats sélectionnés pour planifier une entrevue. Nous ferons notre possible pour communiquer par courriel ou par téléphone avec tous les candidats pour leur faire part de notre décision.
Mesures d’adaptation
L’accessibilité est importante pour nous. N’hésitez pas à nous faire part de toute mesure d’adaptation (salles de réunion accessibles, sous-titres pour les entrevues virtuelles, etc.) dont vous pourriez avoir besoin pour participer sans entraves au processus d’entrevue.
Nous avons hâte d’avoir de vos nouvelles!
